text:
Last night, we went to dinner at Mastrioni's Café on Hualipai.  We were in a small group and were seated quickly by a caring and pleasant Hostess.  The ambiance of the restaurant is quite striking with art works displayed on the walls.  The kitchen is open and the smell of roasting garlic was wonderful to behold and hopefully a promise of the meal to come.  Sadly this wasn't what we experienced.

Dishes ordered included Caesars Salad  for 3 couples for sharing.  When they were delivered, the wait staff hadn't a clue as to how to serve each of the 6 plates to the 6 guests who were to receive them.  The salad consisted of limp wilted lettuce (Iceberg not Romaine?) with barely enough dressing to moisten the sad pile of greens below.  The salad was quite tasteless and a big disappointment.    It certainly was not worth the $10 cost. The bread that accompanied the salad was tasteless as well.  It was perhaps white bread toasted.  The server (or was it his assistant) put some olive oil and balsamic vinegar on the plates in which to dip the bread.  The bread and the balsamic dip were gone in a few moments and never replenished.

Being a large group the members ordered a variety of entrees and represented a good cross section of menu selections.  I ordered Eggplant Parmagian that was accompanied by ziti in a tomato sauce.  (Or was it tomato water?) The ziti was cool not hot, the individual pieces of pasta were stuck to each other and quite gummy.  The sauce was runny and tasteless.  The Eggplant however was plentiful and tasty.  Unfortunately, the sauce on the eggplant was anything but plentiful and far from tasty.  There was barely enough to cover the food below.  My wife ordered a dish of bowtie pasta with broccoli.  It was warm (not hot) and quite tasteless.  Both of these dishes were, most assuredly, not worth the $18, $16 respectively.  

in this town of plentiful eateries how this restaurant serving mediocre food at grossly inflated prices can survive especially with the current economy is a mystery.  Hopefully they will improve over time

This place is absolutely horrible, service and food. 

I really really hope they pay plug on sports radio. 

I had reservation and upon checking in the hostess and the manager seemed annoyed. 15 minutes after my reservation time, I went to host stand to check how much longer. It was as if I asked for their first born child. They were appalled that I even went up there. We ended up waiting half an hour for a table. 
Once the server saw that we were not ordering a bottle of wine, we were ignored the rest of the night. We had to continuously ask the busser for refills and even had to ask him to fix one of our entree orders since they forgot our side of pasta. 

The food tastes like it was frozen. None of the pasta is fresh. The sauce tastes like it comes from a can.

Wow what an amazing place. You would never think a strip mall restaurant could be this classy and the food this awesome. 

I am a foodie. I love everything about the process of prep and the profiles of flavor. If you want a great experience of this just sit at their bar and watch the chef work. You will appreciate your food more.

I had the shrimp app. Very very good. The New York steak was cooked perfectly rare. The tomato garnish was even amazing. That should be a menu option. Very impressive.

So don't think a restaurant can't deliver on quality because it is between a nail salon and a liquor store. This place is outstanding.

my friend lin was visiting me from albany,ny and after picking her up at the airport, we
stopped by about 6 o'clock, before going to my home close by.
the food was good, chicken marcella and chicken parmizon.
we waited and waited and waited for bread and water, however, we were met by
too many attendants (3-4), each watching and switching plates of butter, glasses,etc.
the main server came by too many times, and i was ANNOYED by him!  was he
wanting a higher tip?
the prices were too, too high for this kind of strip-mall place.   2 dinners were
over $40, plus a small tip.

will not go back for this kind of treatment. however, my friend (who was
starving, made a pig of herself, by slopping the hard bread lots of times in the
chicken sauce.  hope no one saw her (she was in the middle of a divorce.
Nicolas Cage sat next to us.  Good Alaskan crab legs, best ever.  Excellent chicken parm.

Awesome! Decided to celebrate my birthday here with the family... We went early on a Sunday night as we have a 4 year old who gets antsy. Every aspect of food, service and ambiance was excellent. I felt like I could've been back on Long Island in the neighborhood red sauce joint. Definitely becoming a regular here!

I would rate this as a one more in a long line of mediocre (at best) Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. I dined with a medium sized group  and had a chance to sample several appatizers, entrees, and deserts; as well as hear comments and view the reactions to the food quality. 

The evening started on an extremely low note and thankfully went up slightly as dinner progressed. The hostess that greeted us at the door was rude and discouraging, and the first person to greet us at our table was even worse- disheveled, rude, uninformed, and just plain insipid.  Thankfully he was just the assistant waiter or bus boy, and our regular waiter was much better (although in all seriousness, the bar was set VERY low). Our table started off with a variety of mixed drinks and appetizers, as well as the bread that was served  automatically. This was the absolute low point in the evening- the drinks were poorly made at best and took entirely to long to get to the table, two of the 3 loaves of bread brought to the table were stale and had to be replaced (even the second set didn't taste very good) and everything seemed to be a hassle to get. I put 100% of the blame on the assistant waiter. You have to understand this guy left you with the feeling of absolute incompetence.) Once the appetizers came, things picked up only slightly. If garlic and salt  sledge hammer flavors are your thing, this restaurant is for you. Of the several apps that I tasted, only the bruscetta was worth going back for, but I grudgingly give a nod to the steamers (white wine sauce and heavy garlic) and the crab cakes (very meaty but not much flavor... how?). Avloid the overcooked calamari and the absolutely boring ceaser salad (really, even a sports bar can get these right)

Dinner was thankfully better, but again the slovenly assistant waiter and overwhelming flavors marred a good, if basic, Italian meal. Of all the meals I sampled, nothing actually stood out, but nothing actually tasted horrible either-  just mediocre and overwhelmingly seasoned.   The veal chop I ordered was tender and very buttery in texture, and everyone that tried the roasted potatoes was in love. My partner was absolutely disappointed in her dish, unfortunately neither of us remember what it was exactly (a pasta with spinach and chicken) Everyone else seemed satisfied but never wowed by their food, and only two plates went back clean- two plates everyone at the table heavily partook of- the veal chop and a mixed seafood pasta 

Desert and the wines served with dinner were the highlight of the evening. I ordered a house Chianti that was very good for the price, and several  others at the table shared a bottle of Chardonay. The regular wine connoisseurs at the table seemed very pleased w/ the wine selection. 

As for desert I was once again able to sample several thing as well as take note of other peoples reactions. Several deserts were ordered and for the most part passed around. Of important note- the cheesecake (rich, dense and creamy but still light,  w/ a hint of lemon flavor) and espresso ice cream pie (very rich and creamy if slightly freezer brunt, but still one of  the table faves)  were most remarked upon and devoured in their entirety, while the tiramisu was almost completely ignored. I took a small bite and what can I say- flat, dead, dull...pointless? This is desert that every Italian restaurant should ace at, yet along with the several coffees and gelatos ordered, nobody had anything good to say about them (all of the coffee drinkers commented on an "off" taste) 

So, to sum up- nothing horrible yet nothing stellar;  the service was OK in some ways but atrocious in others, the food was either serviceable or entirely forgettable, and the bar is a complete failure. Another completely mediocre Vegas Italian restaurant.  Will I go back? Never.

Im so glad  I read the reviews on here and this could be hands down one of the best Italian restaurants on the West Coast. Ive eaten in North Beach, Italy, New York etc..

But this little gem in Vegas is no joke.

Good service, good place to eat to get your Italian fix. I've had the chicken piccata and spaghetti with meatballs and both were great! If they had home made pasta, I would give it 5 stars. Great ambiance.. Modern interior, easy off strip location. I recommend!

The ambience was nice.  The service was good, better than last time.  But the food was not acceptable this time so we won't be going back.  We took our son who is a chef in another city. He said the saute cook was flaring up the fire under the saute pan for dramatic effect and probably ruining the food.  Sure enough my Alaskan salmon was served very overcooked and as soft as Atlantic salmon.  My husband's halibut was served almost raw.  He should have sent it back but didn't.  It's a shame, we really wanted to like this place.
Post Christmas dinner w/friends. WOW - out of the ballpark. Food was to perfection, service too. Definitely my 'go to' place for amazingly delicious Italian. Worth the price. Delicioso!

This is not just italian.  Their seafood is superb.  I had the salmon picatta (heavenly), and my wife had their grilled halibut.  My wife's quote, "It was the best halibut I've ever had."  You cannot do better.

**This was a take out order. ** 
This review is only in reference to three dishes, which are in my opinion are bench marks of simple Italian food and not about the restaurant or wine menu. 

So, I'm half way through eating my spaghetti and meatballs and the first bite I had had high hopes and the hope melted like the meatball in my mouth. The meat was tender and juicy, however their was no flavor or spice. I felt as though I was eating the spaghetti and meatballs from a hospice center. What did help was the scrumptious garlic bread that I used to fill up on. 

After the disappointment, I turned to my friend who got the shrimp linguini and he chowed down on the glorious shrimps first. With a grin on his face he dug into the linguini. Within a few moments I recognized the look on his face, it was the exact look I had when I first took a bite of the spaghetti and meatballs. The linguini and the sauce had a mild garlic butter flavor and he wasn't a big fan either. 

I gave it two stars because of the garlic bread and the shrimp.
I don't understand what the rave is about this restaurant. Don't be fooled by the high praise. Low on taste and definitely high on price. Service was subpar. Wouldn't come back again!
I ordered the Sea Bass Piccata, the best I've had, our waiter Kurt was amazing and delivered an enjoyable prompt dinner. Must go!
One of our favorite Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. I really enjoyed the fettuccine Alfredo and the service was impeccable  next holiday we will be back again.

It's alright. Don't need to spend money here. 
Overall 8/10 atmosphere 8/10 food 8/10 service 8/10 
Food is ok not good not bad~

Have been here often but last time was about a year ago and have not gone back because food was average and cost was silly. Went back 2 weeks ago... likely won't be back. Lots of waitstaff buzzing around but busy chatting amongst themselves and not really paying attention to tables. Wine was delivered fast (yay) food was just average tasting  (chicken artichoke dish and chicken parmagian) had to ask for basil. Oye it's an Italian restaurant no?? One waiter took my knife and I could not get the attention of our waiter and ended up reaching across to another empty table and grabbing one because after 10 minutes of getting our food our waiter never showed up to ask how anything was.. Our waiter showed up near the end with the check without asking us if we wanted dessert. We ordered gelato. It was the best thing we had.

What a great meal.  Went with 12 other people for a birthday party, had stuffed mushrooms, crab cakes, veal, salmon, chicken, Caesar salad, house salad, too much good stuff.  Wine selected by staff was wonderful... I would HIGHLY recommend.  Go for any kind of occasion --you will not be disappointed. Promise.

This place has good quality food. Came here on a Sunday when I tried to go to Rachel's Kitchen but didn't realize they closed at 4. Glad I gave it a shot. Will be back when I come to Vegas again. The pasta was really tasty and service was good too.

This is a nice restaurant.  Went there Friday night. The place was quite busy and it has a nice atmosphere. Our server Nick was on top of things for the most part. My only criticism has to do with how our entrees were served.  Each person in our four person group received their meal separately.  Weird. I mean how hard is it to serve four people at the same time.  The food was very good, from pasta, chicken and veal.  The tilapia picatta was not very tasty.  Fresh fish but way too many capers.  The prices were too high, nearly Strip prices.  $45 for a veal chop is overpriced in my opinion.  Our check was $165 for one appetizer, four entrees, 4 beers, and two sodas.  Just too expensive for a restaurant in a strip mall.  For that reason we will likely skip a second visit.
Pete, his wife, Curt and the chefs were fabulous.  Food, atmosphere and laughter were great and abundant.  Thank you Mastioni's!

this honestly deserves 1 star but the entree saved it from being such.....3 of us go to lunch today, we sit down and the server comes and asks if theres going to be 2 more (table was set for 5, we originally were going to have 5 but ended up not), like 5-8 minutes go by before he comes back to offer us drinks, so we get drinks. Then he scurries away before we can even ask him about putting something in while we wait, comes back several minutes later and we ask him to put in the calamari...i heard good things about this place specifically the calamari, i love calamari so was really really looking forward to it. 

We are snacking on bread and the oil/balsamic mix they give you, its OK...bread isnt anything to write home about...the calamari arrives low and behold it looks plain as can be, as in zero seasoning and quickly flash fried but i give it a shot nonetheless....anddddddd im spot on. $15 for AWFUL calamari, unbelievable. We thought about saying something but just let it go.

So we ordered another appetizer to go along with it, the garlic bread for a whopping $7.....what was it? It was the SAME BREAD they give you for free as much as you want, 5 tiny slices with a little garlic on top and baked....haha next time im bringing my own garlic and just eating it. Unreal.

Entrees made up for it, i ordered the salmon and the others ordered some kind of pasta which he raved about but its compared to the dog crap we were eating for the previous 45 minutes, so its hard to not be better than that. The salmon was ok, but again compared to what we were eating it was heavens grace.

Im definitely not planning a trip back any time soon and would not go out of my way for it, the ambiance inside is beautiful and the place is really really nice looking, but the food sucks.

oh and we were going to ask about the canoli but then we saw it was $10....unless that thing is stuffed with gold, im not paying $10 for a canoli

I tried this place when visiting my Friend who lives in Vegas. I was not impressed. I ordered the scampi with linguini and you could tell the shrimp was previously frozen and then cooked too much. The bread was what you could buy in the market, nothing to write home about. The waiter was very attentive and replaced my scampi with mussels and clams in a  broth that tasted mostly like lemon. I was hoping for some garlic flavor but there was little to be had in either the scampi or the mussels/clams. Nice Chianti!
Kurt was absolutley awsome.We have been here many times over the years,always with good food and service.I just wanted to give a "shout out" to Kurt, he is a true pro.

The ambiance was very welcoming and made me feel like I was back in little Italy in New York. We ordered the brushetta and Caprese Salad as appetizers and the quality and freshness of the ingredients were unlike any Italian restaurant in vegas. It was our first time here thanks to the gift certificate we received from T bird jewels and without a doubt we will be back and will recommend this fine establishment to our family and friends. Our server Dane was very prompt and friendly and never let our water glasses go empty. The service and food were second to none. This will be our new go to place for special occasions. Thank you for making our first experience from the appetizers to the main course out of this world. The stuffed ravioli and chicken marsala were incredible. Will be back soon.

Nice clean restaurant, service was good, but food just ok, seemed like a small portion size for the price 
Garlic bread was great

Love love this place.  Best Italian  food in Vegas ! We visit Vegas every 5 to 6 weeks & always make it a point to eat here. Great food, service, & owner very personable makes you feel welcome every time.  Highly recommend it

first time i have been here after my girl heard great things about it and i realized its the restaurant for the billboard i have seen on the way home many times on the 215. we had the special app burrata cheese with tomatoes. it was good but not heirloom tomatoes really? rookie mistake..cheaper with reg tomatoes but mistake for sure...burrata is amazing though, can't lie...also had the crab cakes it was a big portion size however, not great flavor and needs some work. had the spagetti and meatballs for dinner, noodles were good but not home made, meatballs were a big portion but not as good as lavo...for dessert the espresso cake, 1 word WOW!!! it was amazing and would go back just for that. also love the off the strip prices, the bottle of wine which was a ruffino was $42 which was a steal. great service as well, can't remember his name at the time but super friendly and helpful. 

great little feel inside the restaurant and will go back for that feeling. not the best food but will give it another try for sure. restaurant was packed on a tuesday night so clearly they are doing something right. seems like a local summerlin ritzy crowd. mostly old ppl and we were the only asians in the restaurant other than the ppl who were sat next to us. coincidence? not sure...haha

Mastioni's is beautiful inside and has a nice ambiance.  I was here for a work event and we sat in the back room...may make for a different review.  The service was great and they were very friendly and courteous.  The food was just average, but this may have been due to someone ordering the family style for us.  My favorite part was the puff pastry dessert and the ravioli dish.  Although not memorable for me, I'll stop by and give it another chance, when I can make the menu selections.
I was in the mood for Chicken Parm, came across this place thanks to Yelp. Food is great can't wait to go back.

My third visit within 1 year,the waiters are like used car salesman, food is over priced and over rated. Their wines and cocktails are over priced as well,  What used to be a quite relaxing atmosphere is now loud and "deli like" lots of kids and strollers. My fettuccini alfredo sucked, luckily the portion was tiny. The food here is Italian aspirational. Don't waste your $$$$$

Mike

One of my favorite off the strip hotspots. I actually prefer this over the restaurants on the strip. If I'm ever craving Italian food this is the only place I'll go besides my family's own delicious homemade Italian.. Chicken parmigiana is a MUST try. Pete and his staff never fail to please me and my guests. I wish I could remember my favorite servers name... He's Turkish and has been working there for years, one of the best servers I've ever had. I will remain a happy, returning customer because the food remains amazing and the service is excellent.

Amazing food but a tad pricey. I had the seafood linguine, which was great. Service was good. You can get the same quality food at other places for a bit cheaper, but if you love locally owned Italian spots you will love this place.
Nice neighborhood place.  Been here a few times.  It's kind of hit and miss though...  Stick with the pastas!
First time trying and I am in love! Superb cuisine!!Kurt was the best! Gave amazing descriptions on all of the food and drinks. He was very attentive and so friendly. Definitely will be back.

Very mediocre red sauces and pasta. The shrimp were excellent, but I had the ciappino stew and there were only 2 shrimp and 2 scallops. Mostly calamari. Soup broth was very bland. Service was OK but not exceptional. Everyone in our party felt same. Food was just OK, prices very high.

I have never had a bad meal here. Tonight I had the seafood risotto. It was amazing. The calamari,scallops & mussels were cooked to perfection and so tender.
Their Ossobuco is ridiculously good. Mastrioni's excels with their daily specials. But you also can't go wrong ordering off the everyday menu. The Veal Parmesan is excellent. 
This is a go to spot for my wife and I for special occasions or just a spontaneous date night. For my money, it is some of the best dining in Las Vegas.

Mastrioni's has amazing Italian cuisine!  Their pastas and salads are consistently delicious.  The penne chicken spinach is my favorite and my husband always gets the veal parm.  It is family run and the service is excellent.  Our first visit there, the owner came out to meet us and gave us free tiramisu (which was amazing).  Whenever friends or family come to town, this is where we take them.

We just moved into the area and were looking for a good Italian restaurant...this is not the one.  We started with a chopped salad...not good in, fact terrible, unless you like brown salad and not really chopped.  The main course was OK, just average.  We should have gone to Olive Garden or Macaroni Grill, that has better tasting food and costs less. After a bill of $100.00 that included a $27 bottle of wine, we were not impressed.

I have been on a quest for two years to find a decent Italian restaurant in Vegas. On or off strip, only to be disappointed. And believe me, spending at least two weeks every year in Italy for the last twenty years, I know what I'm talking about. 
I think I finally found what I was looking for. Upon arrival we were greeted by our waiter Kurt who was professional, attentive and knowledgeable. I had the linguine vongole (clams), and it was excellent. Pasta was perfectly al dente, broth had just the right amount of spice and clams were fresh. My wife had the spaghetti with meatballs. Even though not a true Italian dish, (you'll never find pasta with meat balls in Italy, unless you're in a tourist spot frequented by American tourists), the meatballs were awesome, and the sauce tasted like it was made at home. The ambience of the place is great, and we really enjoyed our lunch. Needless to say, were are going to be regulars.
Can't wait to try the other items on the menu.

If you're a garlic lover, go for the roasted garlic app.  $6 and ya get a whole bowl of roasted cloves and plenty of bread to spread it on.  Crab cocktail is nice lump meat.  Cocktail sauce pretty bland but, they'll give ya extra.  Shrimp cocktail nice too ... large (U15 ct) and well prepped ... not at all soft.

Have had fish 3x, and always enjoyed it. Recently tried seafood fra diavalo ... not on menu ... which was wery good.  Nice and spicy, and the seafood was added at the right time during the cooking process to insure product integrity.

Will go back again & again.

So disappointed with the service.
I ordered fish and it looked odd. I asked the server and he said "it's the lighting"
Really?
That was a huge turn off, and ruined our experience

We experienced good food here before but tonight was not good!  The bread was rubbery feeling and boiling hot.....like it just was reheated in the microwave!  Then, I get chicken marsala and it was a watered down, buttery sauce, no idea where the marsala was!  I hope this was just an off night and the quality will come back up.
Best Italian spot in the city. I'll never go to Nora's again. Maybe for a drink. Steamers, Ossobuco, the steak, the desserts, even the seafood is all amazing.
Great food, good service, comfortable atmosphere.  An excellent experience on a Tuesday night in Las Vegas.

I just returned from a Ladies' Luncheon at Mastrioni's. I planned it for 17 women and was helped by Emry. They couldn't have been nicer. The table was set up and four young men catered to our every need. The food was delicious. Several people ordered pasta, several ordered salads, a few ordered fish and I ordered a lobster roll, which had nice chunks of lobster and a lovely side salad. Their lunch prices are very reasonable for the quality. The bread is delicious, and so is the salad dressing. This is my second large luncheon at this restaurant and both times it was superb! They even let me bring in cupcakes, which they served to us.
As a former cooking teacher and caterer (and Italian to boot) I'm very picky about food, and Mastrioni's gets a big thumbs up from me. Great for lunch, happy hour or dinner, Mastrioni's won't disappoint!
wonderful service, family owned charm. food is authentic Italian, just like my family's cooking! my home away from home!
Amazing Food!!! Service was top notch, prices are spot on, atmosphere was real nice... I can go on and on but just do yourself a favor and stop by. You will not be disappointed.

The food at Mastrioni is always excellent however the thing that really keeps me and my husband coming back is the exceptional service. All the staff is very detail oriented and makes sure you have the best experience possible. Kurt is one waiter who stands out and always makes our dinning the best. Kurt has a very likable personality and never lets us down. I would recommend this establishment to everyone who wants excellent food, welcoming environment and awesome service.

The first few times I visited Mastrioni's I thought it was a great place. The food was good, service great and the best Tiramisu in town! Then it started to fall short. The last couple times I went I was less than impressed. On my last visit our server disappeared half way through our meal and we were told by the next server that his shift had ended. Never came to let us know, thanked us, etc. just took off. Never seen anything like that before. The pasta was ok, I honestly have made better at home. I feel the food and the service both have gone downhill and I definitely won't be rushing back here again. If you want to go to a great Italian restaurant where the food and service both are consistently excellent try Parma. It's one of the best Italian restaurants in town!

We have been fans of Petes different locations for decades.  Tonight we had the most disappointing meal in our many dozens of visits to this restaurant. We ordered a stuffed calamari app special that had not too much taste. The signature cioppino soup was bland, it used to have a lot more zest. The cod special was also very bland, the mushroom juice had no flavor at all. 
Such a sad situation with so many new and exciting restaurants opening in the Summerlin area that we will not be making a return visit.

If you are looking for something really good in the Summerlin area then you have to make a trip to Mastrioni's. I've yet to have a bad meal there! Start with the Mastrioni's salad and you can't go wrong! Ask them to split it when you order, it's enough for two people.  An amazing salad with Gorgonzola, walnuts, pears, cranberries and vinaigrette dressing. Mussels with red sauce are excellent and I highly recommend the seafood linguine combo. The special on one visit was linguine with clams, mussels and shrimp in a red sauce. Excellent! The shrimp are huge and fresh! Service is attentive.

Boyfriend and I have been wanting to check out this place as we've been to the liquor store next door. We were disappointed from the start as neither hostess could acknowledge us as they were too busy in conversation with who seemed like a regular and he was more apologetic than they once discovered we had been standing there for some time. We were then told seating was limited but the counter was available.  

The porter brought water and bread quickly. Pete was our waiter and seemed attentive as we ordered our drinks and apps.  The food came quickly. We ordered fried calamari, Caesar salad, chicken Alfredo and chicken piccata.  The calamari was great, the salad was below average for the $15 charged. Boyfriend was happy with his piccata and my Alfredo was bland and chicken way over cooked.  Pete also disappeared after our food was ordered. We wanted to order desert but didn't as we began to get agitated.  

The bill, however was delivered quickly once Pete was found and we were disappointed to spend over $100 on a very below average meal and service. 
You might be better off having a reservation and sitting in the dining room as opposed to the counter.  

There's a great place around the corner called Chef Marc's that's a much better value for a comparable price. And you'll for sure get offered desert.

Our first visit and definitely not the last.  Very friendly staff and our server, Dane, was excellent.... friendly, attentive and professional.  We had the baked ravioli and spaghetti and meatballs.  Both meals were delicious with generous portions.  The meatballs were some of the best I have ever tried.  Dane gave further explanation on a couple of the wines we were looking at and suggested one that we really enjoyed.  Nice selection of wines in varied price ranges.  We thought the menu was a bit pricey, but the ambiance and service, as well as the quality of our meal justified this.  We will be back, and bring our friends next time.
Nice restaurant but I was expecting much more in my meal. I ordered a simple Spaghetti with Meatballs but it was not a success. The spaghettis were soggy and the meatballs lack of taste.

Not as good as it used to be.  Service was horrible and I didn't get my meal until after my husband was almost done.  Had sent it back because it was ice cold. Talked to the owner and he didn't do anything about it.  Customer service has went down hill fast!! I was very surprised with the lack of concern with the owner.

One of my favorite off the strip hotspots. I've been coming here for years and always leave very pleased, the decor is nice so definitely dress upscale. Some of my favorites include the Chicken Parmagiana, Chicken Vesuvio, and NY Steak Pizziola. All different but absolutely mouthwatering. My friend also raves about their Lobster Ravioli (they only make occasionally as the chefs special). She literally calls ahead to see if they have it that night. 

Mastrionis is Family run which is evident from the attention to detail throughout your entire dining experience. 

A must try!
This place is off the charts!!! The food is sensational!! Our waiter Kurt is the best waiter I have ever had and I have had many fine dining experiences.

It was our first time, but we loved it. Super quiet and calming atmosphere. Definitely what I needed right now in my life as I am in deeply painful mourning. Jazz music playing was an added bonus. It was fairly slow because we dined on a Monday, but even as it picked up they never sat people right on top of each other. The staff was extremely courteous and attentive. Never allowed for us to be without water or have to flag them down. Our meals were the best Italian we've had in Vegas. We ordered classic spaghetti & meatballs and chicken parmigiana (bill $38 + tax and worth EVERY penny). Truly delightful with flavors, and reminiscent of home-cooked Italian food. It was hands down the best experience I've had OFF the strip. Typically, for this level of quality in every aspect I have to travel to the strip and mingle with tourist traffic, loudness, and hassle. I'm thrilled that I found it here, without valet, hiking into a loud smoke filled place, or having to travel 20 miles home to Summerlin after. 



Bottom line:
Service 10/10
Food 10/10
Cleanliness 10/10
Atmosphere 10/10
Price point 10/10

This is simply one of the best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. All of the food is delicious the service is great and you have to try the shrimp cocktail appetizer.
Three of the six of us always order the eggplant Parmesan because it is the best anybody has ever eaten. All of the veal dishes are delicious the veal piccata and the veal Parmesan especially. The tiramisu is made there locally by one of the waiters and the service is outstanding. 
How anybody could give this place one or two stars is beyond understanding. 
They would have to own a competing Italian restaurant to give this place a rating like that.

My friend is Siclian and for years I could only eat italian food when I went to his place cause of how good and authentic. Right down to the homemade vodka sauce.  The egg plant parm here is amazing.  With the proper distribution of cheese through out the whole meal.  This is my new spot, best italian in Vegas off the strip guarantee!!

Very solid Italian establishment in the summerlin area. My family and I have been coming here for quite some time now. We almost always get the steamed little neck clams in the white seafood broth, seafood risotto(no longer on menu, but the chef will make it if you ask), veal oso buco, and occasionally the rib eye. 

Overall, a great restaurant that I always come back to.
Great food every time. Easily one of the best tomato basil soups I've had ever. Service is always fast and friendly.

All I can say is excellent. Food cooked to perfection. Service impeccable. A must for any lover of seafood and Italian. Kurt was an excellent waiter making sure our wine glasses were never empty, our food was exactly how we ordered, and left us wanting for nothing. Even though it isn't close, I will make the drive for this place.

I enjoy giving local businesses a try, especially since big restaurant chains can get a bit boring.  Upon arriving, I was impressed with inside décor.  Not bad for a strip mall restaurant.  As for the service, I was not that impressed.  Let me start with the bread, it's plain and not fresh.  I've had better from Smith's grocery.  The seafood appetizer was delicious, something I would order again.  It was the Combo Oreganate, a combination of shrimp, scallop, clams and mussels stuffed with bread crumbs and baked on top of butter and garlic.  That sauce was the only thing that the bread was useful for in dipping with.  The waiter was not very attentive, and when I ordered the entrée and appetizer, he was quick to correct my pronunciation.  Yeah, I get it; I can't pronounce your fricken menu.  Thanks for the lesson.

My husband ordered a steak and asked for it to be medium-well.  I tell my husband to always just order medium, but he's just not a fan of getting red meat.  Upon getting our entrees, we both notice how burnt his steak looks.  I order chicken, so everything seems to be in order.  The waiter drops off our entrees and quickly disappears.  He never once came back to check if everything was ok.  I'm assuming he knew how overcooked the meat was and did not want to address it.  I understand that medium-well means a small amount of pink in the center, not charred and dry.  We had to track down another waiter to send it back.  So the waiter sends it back to the waiter that was helping us and instead of checking the meat, he quickly runs over and says, "What, medium-well is too medium-well for you?"  My husband was polite to respond, but I wanted to deck the guy for his attitude.  I'm not sure if he's an owner, a manager, or lead waiter, but his attitude was crappy.

He goes back and checks things out.  A few minutes later he comes back to apologize.  Gee, you think if you checked the meat out before you made such a comment it would have made the experience less dreadful?  We did not reorder the steak.  The bill was paid and we left with a bad experience.  I would give this place another shot if it wasn't for the comment the waiter made.  I was offended and have a feeling there was a pre-judgment made by the waiter based on our casual attire, but either way, it was uncalled for.  There was definitely a lack of service to correct the situation or for forgiveness to come back and try the restaurant again.

Mastroni's has always been a family favorite, but sad to say, the quality is slowly deteriorating, which is why they get four starts instead of five today. Love the atmosphere and ambience. It's not to quiet, but not very loud here either. I sat at the bar last night, which was a cozy intimate spot in front of the kitchen. We ordered a round of the clams, the cioppino, and the chicken Francese. The clams were a really good, if not perfect, appetizer with warm bread. Unfortunately, I was disappointed with the Chicken Francese: my every time choice meal. It just wasn't that great; it was very bland with nothing to it. Had to much egg too. The sauce was yummy...with bread tho (lol). For the first time in forever, I didn't finish it or ask to take it home. Wah. The man ordered the cioppino, but it wasn't anything special either. Just okay... Sadly, it was his first time at Mastronis, so I'm not sure if I'll be able to convince him to give it another go in the future.Not really sure what's going on here (by the look of the yelp reviews) or if it was a bad night to dine with them, but probably won't revisit again for a bit.

Great Italian Food!!!

Had the baked clams, seafood risotto and cream puffs....All superb...

All in all a perfect meal....Will definitely be back!

Not only was the dinners we ordered superb, but Kurt's service made my birthday dinner over the top. What was particularly appreciated was his attention to detail for all seven of us, including the children. The chef even came out to greet us. My hats off to Mastrioni's. We will become regulars.

We enjoyed every part of our meal . The shrimp in our Entrees were gigantic , the scallops were fresh and all tasted great !  The seafood salad was fresh and tasty . 

We made a reservation for 7pm on a Fri evening , we were seated within minutes . 
We wil be back and have already informed a few of our friends to give Mastrioni's a try . 

From the outside it doesnt look as large and spacious as on the inside . We have No complaints as we thought the prices were fair as well . Being from NYC , Im used to great Italian food in little Italy  . Now living in Vegas Mastrioni's is my go to place for a nice Italain meal .

We celebrated a 50th wedding anniversary at the restaurant. The service alone is worthy of 5 stars. We were treated beautifully. We did not want for anything. 
The antipasti and grilled vegetable platter were delicious. Generous portions. 
I had the chicken Parmesan which I thought was done to perfection. I love when it has little crispy edges. My husband loved his cioppiino, he only wished it came with linguine. Two of the others had osso buco which was gigantic, I had a bite and it was very tasty. The veal cooked perfectly and tender. 
I loved the decor, dark woods, low lighting, tables not too close together.
They made the evening a great celebration for my aunt and uncle.

On a mission to find monster meatballs and pasta to satisfy my italian craving, i eagerly scouted the assistance of old faithful YELP. 

After a few minutes i narrowed it down to a few locations (primarily targeted by distance) and proceeded to make a final call. The deciding factor? 2 things. A picture submitted by a fellow yelper showcasing a beautifully crafted, softball-sized meatball & a picture depicting the interior of the restaurant, Mastrioni's.

And boy am I grateful for YELP and it's users' pics. I admit i wasnt sure what to expect. Mostly positive reviews, a picture that resembled a half way decent restaurant, and a close proximity to home drove my willingness to explore new found culinary options.

Mastrioni's did NOT disappoint. From the moment i walked in, i was impressed. The decor, the lighting, the ambiance, the welcoming faces. It all screamed authentic italian dining experience.

Food was I-N-C-R-E-D-I-B-L-E. I love me some italian food. Im not a professional food critic. But i do love food. And i do love to eat a delicious meal. And i will now be a repeating regular here at Mastrioni's whenever im in town. The Chicken Parmigiana is HIGHLY recommended. It's my favorite italian dish and this restaurant does a fabulous job on a staple meal. The meatballs, oh the meatballs. A mountain of meat easily the size of a softball is moist, flavorful and cooked to perfection. I ordered 2 on the side and didnt even make it to the 2nd. The portions are pretty big so bring ur stretchy pants and appetite. You're gonna need em....both. 

Service 9
Food 9
Atmosphere 9
Overall 9

Recommended: HIGHLY
My mouth waters every time I think about my meal!  The calamari is out of this world.  Go in deep with the bread dipping in the broth - your mouth will water forever after too!

Really enjoyed our dinner here. The service was great. Our waiter Kurt was fantastic, he would make my mouth drool as he explained the specials. He also was able to make me items that were not on the menu. Don't hesitate to ask because I think they only put half the food they offer on the menu. I looked on yelp pics first before arrived so I knew what dishes they were able to make. I had the lobster ravioli and was not on the menu. It is fantastic, beside lobster in the ravioli there are lobster chunks in the sauce. Can't wait to return here. It's a neighborhood gem. I will be requesting to sit in Kurt's section again because he the made the experience that much more better.

Mastrioni's is more than meets the eye, from street-view it can be a bit less desirable but the food makes up for what the restaurant lacks in looks and we all know that what really matters is how your food looks/tastes. The atmosphere is charming with a dash of chatter. 

The excellent service is also paired with a delightful wine list but beware of the portions when choosing your food as the most dishes are fairly heavy. To start we got healthy portions of caprese and calamari to share; followed by veal marsala and fettuccine alfredo; topped off with cannolis.

Definitely will be back if in the area.
Been looking for good  spaghetti for quite a while. This is the best so far here in LV.

Went to Mastrioni's for Mother's Day dinner. As usual the food was amazing.
I ordered the Pasta Fagioli so much flavor and my favorite the Salmon w/ capers.
The food is always great, the service is fantastic one of my favorite restaurants.

This IS the off strip Restaurant of Las Vegas. Everyone posts the pics of the Italian food which is great but it needs to be known that they have some of the best steaks known to man. Hopefully someone will beat me to posting the steak OR  the King crab legs special. Step it up weak sauces and show the rest of the menu some love with some pics!!!

Overall, great Italian food in a random Las Vegas strip mall. Don't let the lack of curb appeal fool you, this place has some of the best off-the-strip Italian food. The ambiance of the place is great, the service was attentive and quick, and food was tasty!

We were sat and quickly received bread with oil and vinegar. The wine list was great and my wine quickly came out with a generous pour. No complaints here! For an appetizer, I ordered a greek salad and also had the stuffed clams for the table. The greek salad was really great and the clams were sinfully good. I recommend dipping the bread in the clam sauce, just a hint from a fellow foodie ;). 

I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs for my entree and told them to make it extra saucy. It came out extra saucy for sure! Their red sauce is really tasty with just the right amount of spicy. The meatballs were huge, but could have used a little more salt or flavor. When I cut a meatball open, I like to see herbs and spices and there was only meat in these. But the entree was good and I would order it again. 

My husband got the chicken parm which he orders anytime he sees it on the menu. He said that the chicken parm was really good, but not the best. However, from a chicken parm expert, a "really good" is saying something!

We will be back for sure.

had dinner here last night with my family, we ran into carlos santana which was fun but the service was just silly....first our waiter forgot my sister's drink, then we waited 30 minutes for 2 dinner salads and 2 entrees for my sister to find a button in her salad!!! they didn't make us pay for her salad but wow.....what an interesting place this is. I doubt I will be returning unless my family wants another button in their food haha

Wow, I entertained a small group of business associates tonight and everyone at the table was extremely happy. Mastrionis is probably one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas. If you are staying at the strip jump in an UBER and make your way to Cafe Mastrionis. Sea Bass, Osso Bucco, seafood appetizer and penna vodka was off the hook. Price was very reasonable also.
A must if you love Italian food. Highly recommend if you come to Vegas. Chicken Marsalla was excellent.
Not only is the food great but our waiter Kurt was beyond excellent, great service and great food, what a perfect combination, give it a try, pricey but definitely worth it! Graci

The hostess was completely incompetent.  We arrived promptly for our reservation. Our dining companions were a few minutes late. There was one other party waiting to be seated. She seated that party and then everything stopped while the waiting area completely filled up. There were plenty of open tables but for some reason she wouldn't seat parties unless everyone was there. Even the full parties didn't get seated while she stared endlessly at the seating chart as if in a trance. 

Except for one group that walked in and she immediately kissed them and whisked them past the huge throng to their table! Pissing everyone else off. 

She assured everyone that their tables were available and being held but inexplicably wouldn't proceed with seating. Is this Outback? Even Outback is more efficient. The food was pretty good with a few missteps. Carpaccio special was excellent as was the Boston chowder. Clam pasta was gritty with the clams obviously not being cleaned thoroughly. 
So sad that by time we were seated we were irritated and cranky. How could any restaurant overcome that start?
This is another one of my favorite Italian restaurants. I wish I could remember about it more often when craving Italian. It is a little secluded but well with the trip when you discover it.

Stopped by here for my first time and ordered take out. Italian food is usually best when eaten fresh and hot, not 45 minutes after being prepared. I ordered the chicken parmigiana and I couldn't have been happier. The serving size was large and the meal was absolutely delicious even though I took it to go. The cheese was perfectly cooked on top of the chicken, and the chicken was perfectly thin and breaded to Perfection. Next time I come back, I will definitely dine in so I can enjoy their culinary experience!!

So I've been going to Mastrioni's since I was in high school and can honestly say I've never had a bad experience or meal. However, tonight when I went their with my gf for the first time we were treated to an amazing evening; in part thanks to our awesome server Kurt. From suggestions to our appetizer selections, wine, and entrees, he certainly made the evening all the more enjoyable. Great energy and fun to talk with. Everyone whose ever been here knows what you have to look forward to when you walk in the door! Tonight was made more special because Kurt was there.

Food taste good..I normally 2 times a month order food to go..Tonight I sat at the bar overlooking the cooking station..I watched a cook have a towel in his hand to pick up hot pans.He would then keep his tongues in the same towel..He would pick up raw chicken, veal and other food with them and put it back in the towel.He then wiped down the counter with the towel..I called over the server and told him..He saw him do everything I saw.He told the chef..The cook never changed and kept doing it.I will be calling the health board.

I went here for my birthday, which also happened to be the day that the Dodgers beat the Cubs and went onto the World Series, and had a fantastic time! 

Whenever I try a new Italian restaurant, I usually always go with the Chicken Parm. Why? Because if you mess that up then I probably don't want to eat anything else on your menu. WELL GOOD NEWS. The Chicken Parm was delicious!! The portions are HUGE, so really you can share this between 2 people and order an app/salad and call it a night. But, if you want to go all out then the Sea Bass is sooooooooo good too. My friend had that and I think I ate most of her food, and well, mine. IT'S MY PARTY AND ILL EAT IF I WANT TO! 

We also had about 5 bottles of wine, not too crazily priced. I would definitely come back here, even if I have to pay.

Went here last night with my parents. We were pleasantly surprised by the interior as we for some reason expected a pizzeria style atmosphere. 
Carey started us with a wonderful glass of Shiraz, my dad, his usual Tanqueray and tonic with lime (which Carey brought out immediately upon his arrival) and appetizers of roasted garlic and Caprese. 
As for entrees my mom had never tried vodka sauce so we both decided on the Shrimp and Scallop Vodka, which were delicious and my dad opted for the N.Y. Steak Grilled (medium/cooked perfectly) with sautéed spinach side MOUTHWATERING! 
We finished off by sharing the Crème Puffs which were YUUUUUUMMMMY! 
Overall it's a wonderful local Italian restaurant. Open about 6 months and will definitely be a regular for us. 
Thanks again Carey for the wonderful service! 
We look forward to seeing you again soon

Cool place, you can sit at the counter & be part of the kitchen. Tried the pork loin & it was very good. Wine was good. Ended the meal with tiramisu (this is my fav dessert) it only gets 2 stars. It needed more cheese & coffee flavor.  It was homemade but they used a cake instead of lady fingers. Would not recommend it :(

Beautiful resturant, friendly waiter. Very good Italian food and good wine. I had the eggplant parm which was so delicious. It was a large serving and came with pasta. They have amazing sauce. I tried the lobster ravioli which is really good too, they put whole lobster pieces on top and it was so good and creamy. I will be back again for sure.

This is a wonderful locals spot. So glad we  were introduced to Mastrioni's by friends. We had the lobster special and then two ordered of the Sea Bass. Everything was cooked to perfection. The lobster was sweet and tender! And their sea bass was delicious. Not over salted but tremendously flavorful. And love their Mastrioni's salad. So nice and lightly dressed with wonderful field green. Service is always efficient and all the meals always arrive hot and in unison.  Love that!

I have to add that our last trip here the fish was just not on par with previous visits. And  it is a bit spendy so don't be afraid to open your wallets!
We love this place! Everything was so delicious. We had an array of specials, all off the menu, and each was better than the next. Can't wait to go back and try actual menu items. Yummmm

It is obvious why this restaurant is so highly rated and popular with the locals.........quality and excellent recipes.

The grilled veggie plate was perfect, the veggies were all still warm, and the garlic marinated peppers were so good.

The seafood salad was traditional and incredibly well cooked....meaning the squid/prawns/scallops were barely cooked thru so they stayed tender. Dressing was perfect balance of evoo and lemon with lots of micro-greens/celery/capers. It was a very large order enough for 4 to share as an appetizer.

The spaghetti bolognese was excellent, as good as I have had in a long time. I am an Italian chef and make this dish several ways and generally don't think much of most bolognese sauce in most restaurants because it is just not that great....often good but not great. This sauce neared perfection. What was amazing was they split it for us and came out with two large pasta bowls filled. The order was huge, great value for sure.

Our waiter Vince was excellent, so friendly and enjoyed talking cucina italiano well after they closed. Kudos to such good service.

We will be back.

Looking for EXCELLENT Italian food?  This is THEE place! I'm originally from NY so the bar is set pretty high, Mastrioni's is by far the BEST I've had in the 6 years I've been here! The ambience is just great! No corny "figures" no gaudy "Italian" flags etc. Our server, Dane, was friendly and had all the specials memorized. He was very friendly and attentive, every need was taken care of. The food was Stellar!!! I had the Chicken Marsala, which was fantastic & a good one is definitely hard to find in Vegas! My 4 other native New Yorker's were impressed with their meals as well! If you're looking for REALLY great Italian food, Mastrioni's is THEE place to go!!!

Great Italian food in Summerlin. A little out of they way but well worse the trip. We have eaten there now 3 - 4 times and the food is consistent great. The other day we tried the King Crab special (not usually on the menu of an Italian place) and is was unbelievable fresh and well prepared.

One of the finest locally owned Italian restaurants in Las Vegas.  Pete and his team unveil an unbelievable list of specials every night.  And, the regular menu is superb too.  Chicken Francese, Eggplant Parmesan, and Chicken Vesuvio are top shelf.

Very good place to have a great dinner with your family. Or a date most definetly. The ambiance is just right. The waiters are awesome and know there stuff. So many things on the menu will not dissapoint you. Alittle pricey. But the dinner will make it up.

5 stars isn't enough, perfect small restaurant, with big portions and great quality! This restaurant is good I am definitely coming here again. Flavor was fantastic and meats were very juicy. The crab legs were pre-cut, which made it convenient! I love this place

The friends we were visiting while in Summerlin took us to Mastroni's on our first night for dinner. They come here all the time and said it's their favorite local restaurant.
When we arrived, I could see why they like it so much. It's a pleasingly intimate restaurant and during dinner hours the ambiance is somewhat romantic. This is a great community place for couples and families to enjoy.
I ordered the Seabass blackened. The Seabass was prepared perfectly, broiled and lightly rubbed with Cajun spices. I went with the Penne marinara as my side option, it was a little bland, but a pinch of salt made it a decent side. Everyone at my table was very happy with their meal, which would not have been complete without a few glasses of wine. 
Overall, I enjoyed dining here, it was very relaxing and a perfect place to enjoy good food and conversation with friends and family.

Been wanting to come here for a long time, a friend said it was so good. I ordered a glass of wine, they were out of stock, I ordered another glass that was good. Then we ordered dinner, I ordered the clam chowder and shrimp scampi linguini again, they were out of the chowder, the linguini had burnt garlic in it and tasted horrible. My daughter ordered the rigatoni and it was good, the waiter brought me a new shrimp linguini and it was excellent. Because I had to wait for a second meal, my daughter had already finished and was ready for dessert, but a dessert menu came way after the fact. When it came time to pay the bill, I was charged for the clam chowder that I never got! I left disappointed and won't return.

We were visiting relatives in LV and they took us there for dinner. I had the Shrimp Francoise and it was the absolute best I've ever had.  Service was great too but I can't stop telling everyone about the meal. Shrimp were Hugh. Had sauteed spinach instead of pasta. Best meal I can ever remember having.
Love this place the best Italian food in Las Vegas and great prices. Promise you will love it! Pete the owner and chef Shaun what a team thanks guys keep up the great work.

Great dinner. Had some customers in town and wanted to take them near their hotel. Mastrioni's was highly suggested by a colleague of mine. We were very pleased and not disappointed at all. Kurt took care of us and we went with all his suggestions! What an incredible dining experience. We will definitely be back to try different things on the menu.

From start to finish,  we had a great dinner. Food was excellent and service was great. We had the Osso Bucco which was excellent, meat was so tender! The combo oreganate was also terrific, with the big, fresh scallops, shrimps,clams, and mussels in a delicious sauce! Will definitely be coming back!!

So this being my first yelp I couldn't be happier to say not only does Mastrioni's never fail to deliver their is amazing (especially their special grilled calamari) but Kurt is my favorite. He makes everyone feel like family and the food makes you feel like home ( being Italian myself) so all in all it's a win!

I don't eat meat so I am super picky about my seafood and this place is da bomb!! We've been to Mastrioni's at least 6 times and my go to favorite is the Seabass Picatta but I also love the Eggplant Parmagiana. When we get a table or booth we always ask to sit in Kurt's section, he makes the evening super special and a real professional but it's also a treat to sit at the bar and watch all the kitchen action. Chef Shawn is a master at what he does and the Cioppino or the Boullibasse are 2 items not to be missed. Easily the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.
Best up-scale Italian steak and seafood on the West Side.  Been there three times, never disappointed.  A bit unassuming from the outside.  ....but so was Nora's.

I love this restaurant.  My husbands family come here every sunday when they're in town.  Its your typical italian place, lots of pasta, a few steaks and some sea food. 
Being a pretty good italian cook (if I do say so myself haha) I an be pretty tough on italian places.  I wouldn't put it past mine, but its still great.  The staff is always wonderful, Nick is our favorite server.  
I have also worked with Shelley, the owners wife, on coordinating a 20 person private party, she was great to work with and very accommodating.  

If you're ever in the south summerlin area give it a try!

The only reason why am giving this restaurant a four out of five instead of a five out of five rating is because of the pretentious/weird/not the most inviting attitude from the hostess (hopefully she is not the owner but acted full of herself enough to possibly be the owner or related to)----on the other hand ....Kurt and Danny were AMAZING and my party and I will be back because of them and the food!!!! Thanks guys!!! You made the experience!!!!!!

Had high expectations for this place, but left really bummed out. 

My family and I initially were set on another Italian place, but we left since the hostess said it would be a 45 to an hour wait without a reservation. Since we already had our hearts set on Italian food, we decided to go to mastrioni's since it seemed to have good reviews. We got there and , to our delight, were seated immediately. Service was prompt and decent, but the food was realllllly blah. 

For starters we had the combo oreganate. It had baked scallops, shrimp, mussels, and clams stuffed with breaking. It was okay at best. The sauce was bland, and the whole thing just lacked flavor. My son and I shared the chicken fettuccini Alfredo, and my husband had the lobster ravioli. The lobster ravioli was quite good-- sauce was light yet creamy, and there was a substantial amount of lobster in the dish (albeit a little overdone). Now the chicken Alfredo was an entirely different story. The pasta tasted like the dried pasta you get from the supermarket, and the sauce was no different. Seriously, it tasted just like canned/jar sauce! The chicken pieces did not have any seasoning and was very rubbery, and overall was just very unpleasant to eat. I normally scarf down my food and very rarely leave left overs, but I even surprised myself with how reluctant I was to take more than 5 bites of this dish. I feel like the taste of the food we ordered did not justify how much we had to pay for our meal. 

Who knows, maybe Alfredo just isn't their specialty, or maybe the chef was a just bit light handed with the seasoning tonight. Since it is an Italian and seafood place, maybe they just specialize more on the seafood, and not so much the pasta. Many thoughts come to mind as to why our experience was less than stellar, but will give them the benefit of the doubt for now.

Made a 5:30 reservation as it was our anniversary and we wanted to beat a Saturday night rush.  Arrived at 5:30 and were promptly seated.

Right away, we were given fresh bread and our drink order was taken.  Our waiter came right behind to state the specials, one of which I ordered which was Osso Bucco with lamb.

Our appetizers were excellent, I had a bruchetta with very thick toast while the wife had the 3 tomatoes/mozzarella plate that was so fresh it was like cream. My wife's entree was a shrimp alfredo with very fresh shrimp and perfectly cooked pasta.  My lamb was falling off the bone as it was so tender and juicy.

We were full but I had to try the creme brulee which was outstanding, again just a soft texture.  The atmosphere is light and not stuffy, plenty of staff working to handle the rush and there is a bar with several televisions which had the basketball/hockey playoffs on.

Unlike a lot of restaurants in Vegas that charge high prices, the total for our dinner including tip was only $165.00 which also included an alcoholic drink for each of us plus a glass of wine.  I also ordered a slice of cheesecake to take home for our babysitter.

There are many restaurants in Vegas but this is one not to be missed.  We will be back and wholly recommend to anyone.

Update on this Mastrioni's 7-1-2016.
I have since gone back and given this another chance.  It was super and back to the original service I experienced originally.  The owners are from New York and have made this place one of the best Italian places in Vegas.  If you like watching the kitchen and food preparation, sit at the bar and enjoy the show!
Original review 6-3-2015
First off let me say this was my go to Italian place!  Ive gone 6+ times and have no problems with the price as long as the food is great and service is super too. 
That being said...one of my favorites is the seafood over linguini....in the past it was awesome with a nice blend of seafood.  This last time...it was LOADED with calamari and they were as rubbery as hell.  I literally could not eat it.  I was stunned!  Usually the food has been SO GOOD in the past...I wondered if they changed owners or chefs.
I ate what I could...then decided some spumoni pie with coffee would end the meal on a high note....well not so.  The coffee was good..but the ice cream spumoni pie was direct from the deep freeze and was HARD as a rock.  It was not edible until it defrosted for 30 mins....I was so disappointed in Mastrioni's.

I did mention it to the waiter...but he just shrugged it off saying it will get better when thawed...well no duh.

Then to end the evening...the wait staff do not seem to know what one is doing with the others.  The table next to ours....the couple left...and it sat for a few mins before they could clear the dishes.   Then another wait staff came over and removed the table cloths and napkins and placed clean a clean table cloth on.
LOL then the original wait staff came over and  removed the table cloth thinking it was dirty...and proceeded to put another one.  It was comical.  Hopefully they will smooth out the rough edges.

Kirk is the best at taking care of us. Never did we want for anything.  He was very attentive and a real classy guy. This just tops off the best Italian food in Vegas. When our family comes in from New York we always bring them here. We love this place.

Kurt was an excellent waiter along with the entire staff. Everybody is friendly and it truly gives a very nice homey feel to the experience. My family and I have gone several times and have never been disappointed by anything we have ordered.

I'm usually not a fan of Italian restaurants.  I'm more of a spicy ethnic or sushi type of diner; HOWEVER, Mastrioni's is the exception.  So decadent.  We dined here on New Year's Eve (lucky to get a reservation)  Everyone's meal (including my picky 9-year old's) was perfect.  Being that the diet started on 1/1 we gorged on amazing bread, penne with shrimp, scallops and vodka sauce, lovely wines and festive mixed drinks.  Perfection.
Kurt provided EXCEPTIONAL service and dinner was absolutely phenomenal, as usual. I love having this amazing restaurant in my neighborhood.

The food was above average . I will not return based on the  poor/slow service from our waiter Kurt. The hostess/manager  ( about forty dark hair pulled back)at the door seemed angry and was unpleasant from the minute we walked in. To summarize the evening: food was bought and placed on our table that wasn't even ours. It was then picked up from our table and served to the table beside us. All of our entrees were brought at different times,the last entree didn't arrive till the rest of the table were pretty much done with their entrees After all entrees were served ,eaten and cleared,we asked about the salad. It was brought at that time. The waiter Kurt came over to me and apologized for the really bad service.He brought over cream puffs gratis. He still charged us for the coffee that came with the cream puffs and for the salad that we had to practically beg to receive. I would have liked to discuss the bad service with a manager but we couldn't find one. This being my first visit I had great expectations i was very let down.

Still delicious!  I have no clue why we don't dine here more often... I live like 5 minutes away!

We had:
*Lobster Ravioli (special of the night)
- TO DIE FOR!  Very generous on the lobster.

*Cheese Ravioli
- A classic done right!  You can tell the pasta is homemade.

*Crab Cocktail
- AWESOME!  Fresh crab and the cocktail sauce = money!

*Tomato Basil Soup
- Another classic done perfecto.

Had a couple of great glasses of Chianti to accompany dinner.

We had to box up a few things and they wrapped everything very nicely- including the soup!  The leftovers were SO GOOD!

I wish I had room for dessert- hopefully next time.

Service is great and everyone is very nice and attentive.

What a great local place and they take reservations!
Truly the best fish in Las Vegas, the halibut piccata is beyond amazing!  The Caesar salad is excellent!  Service and atmosphere are 5 stars!

As a long time local, I've passed the billboard on 215 West near Jones many times and decided to give it a try with out of town visitors. The ambiance is lovely and very conducive to visiting so perfect when leisurely is in order. Since the space is small, a strong smell of fish hits you at the entrance but becomes unnoticeable once in. The menu is diverse and offers many options. While I wanted to fall in love, I fell into hmmm...maybe...kinda sorta. Service was fine-hostesses were charming unlike many locations, and the sea bass piccata and summerlin salad were very nice. My companions were lukewarm about their salmon entrees as the darkness of the underside seemed to be a deterrent, but my main issue was the plating and lack of fullness for the price. The salad was $13 which is firm for what it was, but sea bass at $36 with a side of room temperature vegetables was too much. For $36-there should have been a small amount of roasted potatoes or such  and the presentation would have been better if the included vegetable side had been on the plate so the bass wasn't so lonely looking. Flavor was fine but in competing with the big boys at big boy prices-up the food presentation and include a carb side to fill out the plate as I am home now and snacked a bit after dining out.. and promise I'm not a giant :)

Good food is always better when great service is provided also. No complaints about the food. I love the baked clams,just like I had when I was a kid in Bensonhurst Brooklyn,soak up the wonderful garlic juices with their fresh bread. Our friends had the veal shank,it was huge and fell off of the bone,never tasted anything like it. I had the Marsala,chicken this time but the veal is great also. My wife had the eggplant parm this time,tasted like a  light cheesy eggplant dream. 
Another plus? Carlos Santana was here this evening at the counter,a regular from what we've been told,and it was a pleasure to meet and talk to him.

This is such an Italian establishment for us. We celebrate birthdays and many special events here, and have created many happy memories here! The linguine and clams (mix of chopped and whole) are the best. I haven't been able to order anything else in the 6 years we have been dining there... grilled veggie appetizer is a favorite too. As others weather cools, there is nothing like a hearty Italian feast!!!!

Step above chain restaurants but I'm afraid not by much.  Need to learn to prep the steaks before grilling, I don't expect Peter Luger's but .......steak was ice cold in the center.  Ruined two steaks in one shot and no apologies; there should have been one to the restaurant owner and one to the customer.   Salad, same amateur hour here, drowning in oil, wilted to a point of being stuck to the plate.   If this is a chef owned restaurant, I commend your savvy on picking a market where you have a chance.  If this was a Batali place several heads would have rolled, I know that personally.  One in the BOH and two in FOH.  We all know mistakes happen, we all know how a good places handle them.

I really enjoyed my meal here. We were with friends and family. 

Hey have a great innovative menu, and if you love seafood with a Mediterranean flair, this is the place for you. 

My son had linguini with clams and it was perfect: al dente pasta and fresh clams. I had the Bouillabaisse. It wasn't as good as in southern France or northern Italy, but I was happy. 

For dessert we had Tiramisu, and it was homemade, fresh and excellent.  

Great beers and a nice wine list.  Service is great.
My fiance loved the penne with vodka sauce.  Good wine selection.

Two years later...and Mastrioni's is still dynamite. Went last night with three others and we all had pasta - chicken piccata, shrimp scampi, linguini and clams, and sausage and peppers. All four dishes were fresh and delicious. We just about licked the plates clean. I have eaten in a lot of Italian restaurants, and Mastrioni's is still at the top of my list.

When you're craving Italian  and do not want to dress up, this is the place to go. They've got great dishes to choose from. Prices were a little bit pricey but still comparable to  Maggiano's. I had the shrimp fettuccini with HUGE succulent shrimp! I definitely would order this dish again. Definitely a must try.

For what we got, it was fantastic!  I came here for a date and it was romantic and modern and gave you enough time in-between courses to talk/sip on wine.  We got crab cakes for the appetizer which were filled with giant pieces of crab an were quite good although the tartar sauce was just eh.  The shrimp cocktail sauce on it was far better.  I got the shrimp fettuccine alfredo and it was decadent.  It was so thick and luscious and filling and although only 4 shrimp came with it, they were massive!  My date got chicken, sun-dried tomato, and mushroom pasta and from the bite I had it was really good as well.  I also had a glass of chardonnay from their extensive wine list.  I wanted to try so much more their!  I wish their prices were a bit cheaper but if the food is going to be that good, I will pay them.  The portions are more than substantial especially with how rich the food is.
The grilled halibut with grilled veggies was phenomenal. Server was really great and even got a visit from the owner and chef Peter Mastrioni. Great restaurant. Great food.
I love their Palm salad unfortunately it's hot or miss. Sometimes it's amazing and huge and fresh and other times the salad is wilted and slimy.

The best service from Kurt! Went there for my birthday, he chose my entree, dessert, and drinks with an amazing confidence and chose wisely! Enjoyed the meal fully and had good laughs with Kurt! Everything was very delightful and delicious!

Grabbed dinner here when visiting Vegas. Our waiter was awesome. Super friendly, very accommodating and very attentive to our table. I wasn't very hungry so I only ordered a Caesar salad and  ordered some Parmesan risotto they had as a side for a special! I was so glad they were willing to do that for me. Everyone was very pleased with their dishes. we'll probably go back and hopefully I'll get a real dish next time!

The best Italian food I have had in years! Their meatballs were delicious, chicken parmesan and osso bucco were also excellent. The prices are very fair for the quality they provide. I will be returning to this establishment in the very near future.

Pretty good!  This is one of those neighborhood restaurants where the servers know practically every customer.  So it did feel like we were crashing a party.  Still, the baked clams (oreganate, whatever that means) and eggplant parmigiana were both amazing and the service was good.  And they serve red wine at the correct temperature (slightly chilled).  Amazing!

Interesting dessert options that I did not get to try.  Roasted banana gelato, for example, sounded yummy but we were just too full from the fried food.

Full liquor license but I didn't see an actual bar.  There is a bar that overlooks the kitchen but I couldn't figure out where the alcohol was coming from.

The hostess looked like she wanted to kill me in my sleep, though.  That was a little awkward.  Still, a good neighborhood joint.

I tried this place in a different manner, I went there for dinner the place was packed! Definitely would recommend a reservation on the weekend,  it was really cute and datey. Perfect place for a small cute romantical dinner for two.
I did not really order off the menu, so I cant speak much about how large their variety was. We asked to be sent things out to try from the chefs recommendations. Some of the dishes I never thought I would like  I was really surprised with and loved!! Most of the things we tried appetizer wise have a little twist in them which makes me a happy camper! I love the ambiance and the food, for sure I wana go back and order an Item or two from the menu and compare them to my normal liking! 
But IF I can give a recommendation I would definitely recommend the tiramisu cake that is home made!!! Its one of the best I have ever had, LOVED it!!

Woohoo! As good as it gets!!

How funny would it be if that was my whole review? But it's not, because I was so blown away by the food and service at Mastrioni's that I have a lot to say! First of all, my server was superb and so was everyone that helped him bring the food to my table. Our drinks were never empty once. I felt so well taken care of as a customer that I literally wrote on the receipt, which is something my mom would do! Garrett was our primary server. He was kind, quick, and attentive. He hit the perfect spot for service between over-bearing and just plain helpful. 

I have to admit that I didn't think this would be such an excellent restaurant. I didn't look up the prices and based on the outside I expected it to be cheaper/faster than Olive Garden! I was certainly confused!! This place was pricey, like $30 a plate pricey. I should have paid more attention to the $$ on Yelp, but I just saw it had good reviews and went for it. Beyond the initial shock of looking at the menu, everything that accompanied was spectacular. It is mich bigger than it seems on the outside, the atmosphere is open and dim and perfect for a romantic date night. My boyfriend was in a T-Shirt so we weren't prepared for the romantic part but we were sure ready to eat.

I hate that I didn't take any pictures but I was so busy enjoying myself that the phone didn't get touched until desert. Those cream puffs, though. Yumm! If cream puffs are an obsession of yours as they are mine, you will be pleased. Working backwards, Eric had a shrimp parmigiana which was probably our least favorite thing. It was good but I wouldn't order it again with all the other delicious options. I had the seafood combo linguini with white sauce and it was amazing. The amount of seafood was everything I ever wanted, it was basically half seafood and half noodles. Normally I feel lucky if my seafood linguini comes with a few muscles - this one had that and scallops and octopus and all manner of seafood galore. We had the fried calamari for an appetizer which was great but not different than any other good calamari. We also split a Summerlin Salad made with arugula which is my favorite green. It came out already split, gotta appreciate that extra effort!

I drank a few glasses of moscato which may be messing with my ability to critique, but as of right now I just can't wait to go back to Mastrioni's! I just wish I knew how to pronounce it.

Amazing food, great service and nice atmosphere.
We have been to Mastrionis about a dozen times and have never had a bad experience.
The food is delicious, comes out hot.
We enjoy it so much it's a monthly dinner spot for us.

First impression was being greeted, or should I say NOT greeted by two, (why two?) Hostesses.  They were both very unprofessional, dressed in casual, old stretched out sweaters, snobbish, did not feel welcome at all.   The server, however was great, he was fun, full of info about the food, and business of the restaurant, and very attentive.....until the end.   The place looked clean, tables were set nicely....but the food ? "Meh"  I've had better Italian at a Pizzeria.  The pasta was undercooked, the raviolis were frozen, the sauce was very bland, (canned?).  The price of the food did not match the quality at all, high priced for frozen and canned.  At the very end we were left sitting and waiting, .....and waiting for the server to come back to our table to take the check and then to return with the receipt...that process took 20 minutes all by it's self....made us feel like we were just not very important at all...Not acceptable...We will not go back, and we are sorry we spent over $80.00 for dinner for 2 there.  Our mistake.

One of my favorites in town.  Great food and service to match.  Without a doubt the BEST crab legs in town. We went with a group of 12 and not one left dissatisfied.
