A few had never been there and have become regulars. Great wine list (Prisoner Magnum!) and fairly priced but you can bring your own with a nominal corking fee. Nice ambience and for the location-no where near the Strip! Works for me !
Dined here in December of 2016.

OOOOMMMGGGG found my favorite Italian spot in Las Vegas ... The service the food all on point .. My wife had The clam linguini it  was so good not heavy very light and full of flavor . I had the chicken parmigiana w a side of penne marinara , the chicken for once was not a a big glob of breading .. So light and flavorful .. I can't wait to come back ...
The service is great. The food is very tasty. The atmosphere is cozy. My wife and I really enjoyed everything. We will definitely be back.
Awesome service for a great little Italian place! Justin is so funny and witty and made our small group of 3 laugh and enjoy a birthday celebration! Great dinner!

The food was excellent. Our server was lukewarm but the table next to us had a great server, I heard how he was talking to the patrons, and I really wished he was our server! He sounded so excited about the food he had great suggestions I wish I would've had him as a server.
The young lady who seated us gave obvious attitude when I asked if we could be moved to a different table than the one she first offered.
Waiters and second waiters were helpful and attentive. At these prices I would've expected every server to be excellent as the one at the table next to us. 
Ambience is very nice, however, why does every restaurant, even a really nice one like this, have to have the big screen TV with the sports on? Seriously folks, can't we take a break one night from Sports and go to have a nice drink or a nice dinner? 
Back to the food, I got the shrimp fracase and my daughter got the chicken piccata. Grandson got fettuccine Alfredo off the kids menu. All very good and I'm trying to post pictures.
Wonderful meal. Don't know why I waited so long to return. Crab cakes, pasta fagioli, salmon. All delicious. Attentive and friendly service. I'm looking forward to my next visit.

My friend chose Mastrioni's for her birthday celebration.  What a rotten dining experience!  It was like a newly opened restaurant where the staff doesn't know the menu or specials and don't know their job duties.  After ordering, we realized we hadn't heard the daily specials and had to ask.  We ordered drinks at the same time but my two friends got their iced tea and I had to wait for water.  They brought two of our meals and it took another 10 minutes for the third one to be delivered.  My ravioli was boring.  The ricotta cheese was like eating it straight from the carton and the sauce was bland.  It was merely palatable.  The birthday girl's meal was not what she wanted so we sent it back to be recooked.  Most restaurants would tell the cook staff it was a refire so it would be a priority, not Mastrioni's.  We were done with our meals and her's still hadn't come.  We had to ask several times for a status.  Also, a waiter refilled one iced tea but failed to refill the second one, left the table to get more water for me and it took 15 minutes for a refill.  We asked him for the iced tea and he went to get it.  When he came back he forgot the water but asked my friend if he could take her empty plate and she said yes.  He reached for the plate and we asked about the birthday girl's meal, he said he would check on it and left the table with the empty plate still on the table. The we saw him breaking down a dirty table without a status on my friend's food. The birthday girl had to get up and go over to him because he never came back with a status. The birthday girl discussed all  of this with the manager and we never saw the manager again. Mastrioni's was a disorganized mess!

This is my second review for this neighborhood restaurant.  We eat here on average once a week because the food is always really good and sometimes it's great.  Last night it was great.  I ordered the simple dish of Pasta E Fagioli soup instead of my usual rib eye or crab legs.  The flavor was fabulous and for such a simple dish, very satisfying.  I thought it was one of the best I've had in the city.  As always, the wait staff was impeccable and in spite of the chef not being present since it was his night off, the kitchen staff performed seamlessly in concert.  My husband and I enjoy the friendly neighborhood vibe combined with professional service and delicious food.  I gave it 5 stars this time because after dining here weekly for 3 years I have never had a bad dish and almost always, the food is great.  It is one of the shining stars for locals and the Summerlin restaurant scene.
Great food...got a gift card...used it and the food was great! Plan on going back again sometime im the near future.

This used to be our favorite Italian restaurant in Summerlin. Their eggplant parmigiana is always delicious as well as the rest of the things we order.  Service used to be exceptional. The last two times we have been, service was terrible. Tonight, we took our family there and was placed in the corner table. Our server either had too many tables or just didn't give us the attention we deserved. There was a birthday party at another table that were taken care of as we sat for an hour without food. Our appetizers came before our wine. They completely forgot about my eggplant parmigiana. Everyone else at the table was served and when we asked they said they forgot and were making it right then. While I was still eating (and it wasn't even hot), we ordered our kids dessert, so we wouldn't have to sit for even longer. I also don't remember them asking if we needed anything after our food was served. I'm just really surprised at the lack of customer service.

Let me start off by saying this place has absolutely delicious food. However, I cannot give it the full 5 star rating due to one time where my food was a giant ball of oil. The prices are extremely reasonable! Great place to bring a date or the entire family. Quiet, relaxing atmosphere that could either be used for romance or just having a moment of cooling down from the desert heat.

Justin, our server, was beyond professional.  He was very much on cue with customer service. Had the baked ravioli, baked ziti, and the special, King Crab Legs. Simply delicious. Got us right in at 6pm with no reservations. Thank you Justin.

Still can't quite decide. Had dinner here. 4 of us. All 4 don't drink. $288+tip so $343 was total in the end. Everything was good. Nothing was blow me away good. What was great was a night out with my wife and our friends. Service was very good. There's really not much in Vegas for a nice sit down meal off the strip and that's why I think it gets all the high marks. Don't get me wrong it wasn't bad. But for the price I'd wayyyy rather Vitners grill or drive to the strip. I wouldn't avoid it. It's worth a visit to try it out, but it won't be where I take mom when she comes to town to visit either.
Just ate here for the first time and my experience was excellent! The ravioli was delicious and the staff was attentive and polite. Wonderful Italian food!! I will be back!
So glad we happened to see this place on Yelp! Amazing service! The lobster ravioli was absolutely fantastic! Husband had the Chicken Parmesan and said its the best he's ever had.

Wow! First time at Mastrioni's. had a crazy craving for Italian at lunchtime and they totally delivered and then some. Wine (it's Friday, give me a break) was perfect, garlic bread TO DIE FOR and the Mastrioni's salad perfectly wet with balsamic. Linguini with whole clams and white wine sauce YUM! My partner had the halibut bruschetta and devoured every bite. Our service was perfect. Definitely coming back!

There are 2 reasons why this place is getting 3 Stars from me. Reason number one is that i actually never physically ate inside the restaurant. I usually just order for pick up & eat it at home. So i can't really give it a full rating until i actually sit in and dine. I love their food. Their Ziti, meatballs & raviolis are good. My husband enjoys their steaks also. Now the second reason why they got 3 stars from me is because of customer service over the phone. About 90% of the time when i ordered i get the same girl on the phone. I don't know her name, but she sounds like she does not want to be there. If you ask her a question it seems like you're bothering her and she responds back with a bit of an attitude. She also tries to rush you off the phone. I will try to visit this restaurant in the near future and actually dine in so that i can update the review. Hopefully the service in person is a whole lot better.

Had dinner tonight at this nice little Italian place.  Arrived at 6pm and waited about 15 min. for a table.  There were people waiting in line to get in.  Unusual for a place way off the strip, or for a place not located in Town Square or Boca Park.  We had a young lad serving us that was quite pleasant and efficient.  I ordered the house salad with balsamic dressing that was excellent.  My main dish was just a basic penne with meat sauce.  I thought it was very average.  The restroom was very clean.  The customers were well dressed. Young blonde hostess was nice.  I got kind of annoyed every time the front door to the place opened, a strong odor of cigarettes came in from the smokers outside.  Not much they can do but I hate the smell of smoke while I am eating.

The wife and I had a terrific date night here.  Great food, great wine.  Our waiter Kurt was the perfect server for an Italian restaurant.  We had linguini with clams and the ossa bucco special and both were tremendous.  Can't wait to go back

I wish there was an Italian restaurant as good as this in southern California. The alfredo sauce is homemade. The chicken was chopped into perfect size pieces and cooked to perfection. The pinot noir from Sonoma County has a great body and aftertaste. 

I tried my girlfriend's chicken parm and realized that it was, too, probably the best I've had. 

If you're near the red Rock, come to this place.
Great dinner. Awesome seafood risotto special.   Ask for Kurt he was a awesome. He was on point. Easy parking. Crab cocktail and Mastrioni's salad to start. I will definitely be back again real soon.

Kept hearing about this place on espn radio. The guys keep raving about the food there and thought i would take my fiancee here. I ordered the scampi shrimp and the seafood linguini (it advertises as fresh seafood). Biggest mistake ever. The seafood was not fresh at all. All of it had that fishy taste that old seafood gets. The shrimp was cooked well but it tasted horrible. The calamari and mussels were bad too really fishy taste. I just went there tonight and will not be going back. I get that its vegas and there is no ocean here but this was laughable. The total check was 150 after tip @ 20 percent. The service was good and fast but goodness was the food awful. I cannot recommend this place. I have had better food at olive garden.

John is a amazing! Treated with such care, he made sure for my birthday I got the lasagna which is out of this WORLD good. Handmade from scratch. PS not usually a pasta fan and this is extraordinary. Thank you John for making my birthday so special!

Giving this place 3 stars is a lot for the experience that I had. Let me start by saying the food here is excellent! In addition the speed of service is also great. My complaint here is not the food so much as the ambiance and a specific server. I honestly wish I had kept the receipt with the servers name on it bc I couldn't tell you what it is. However I know he is an older man who wears his glasses around his neck. The experience I had with this server was terrible. I will start by saying he is very educated in the specials and the menu and was able to suggest many meals to us before we even opened the menu. However, when myself or anyone at my table asked about how a certain item is he just said it was great and almost seemed like he was annoyed. Now let me say, I am also a server and know sometimes tables can be annoying but obviously I work for tips and know that my guests spend a lot of money to come out to eat and I should show them great customer service. We began the meal by ordering the caprese salad which was on the pricey side it was $17 for about 4 pieces of buffalo cheese and about 5 tomatoes none the less it was delicious. Typically when the food is ordered the server will bring the oil and balsamic vinegar prior to or when the meal is delivered. This server didn't, which is fine everyone forgets things from time to time. What upset me was that when my 15 year old brother asked him for balsamic vinegar he asked for balsamic vinaigrette which he soon corrected himself. The server responded with "I got it I know what you mean you're food just came out" with an attitude. Strike one. I didn't like that response again coming from a server my response would've been absolutely I apologize I didn't think your food would come out so fast or something along those lines. Ok, strike one I'll let it go. A little while down the meal an older "bougie" woman was sitting behind us with one of the chefs. Now keep in mind, I'm Pacific Islander and have a sleeve of tattoos, typically I get judged by ones who think they are of a higher class. None the less, I can definitely afford to be eating at this restaurant. Anyway, she sat with the chef and continuously stared at my family and myself and was making comments to the chef and our server. Whatever I also let it go, it was my younger brothers birthday and I wasn't going to let some random woman ruin it. But what upset me was when she muttered something to my server he looked back at her laughed and said "I would respond but I don't want to offend anyone else in this room." Clearly I knew he was talking about my table, because I know he wasn't talking about the 4 elderly people having a quiet dinner in the corner behind us or the two business people eating beside us. I found it to be rude but again said nothing just thought ok strike two. Now what really tipped me over the edge to where I just had to pay out and leave because again I didn't want to ruin my 15 year old brothers birthday; I asked the busser before asking for the check if the restaurant does anything for birthdays. He said they do bring it out but you have to pay for the dessert. I had a cake at home for him so I didn't want to pay for a dessert my brother is a kid and I know kids like to feel special on their birthday that was all. So again coming from someone who works in the industry I thought let me double check with my server because sometimes the bussers don't know. I checked again and advised the server I asked the busser and this is what he told me. The server annoyingly looked at me and said "yes you have to pay, did you want something"? I said no it's fine he doesn't need the dessert it was just the matter of if you did do something complimentary it would be a nice touch to the night and make him feel special. My server looked at me and said "no we don't sooooo the check"? I said ok yeah sure lets close out. After he brings out the tab before running my card he picks up a dinner candle off another table, puts it in my brothers face and shouted "we have a birthday" laughed, picked up the check and proceeded to close us out. Aside from wanting to knock him out at this point because he was clearly mocking me i felt extremely bad for my younger brother who was completely embarrassed. Needless to say he did NOT blow it out. The experience was completely rude and I was completely baffled to have been treated the way our server treated us. The food was great and for four of us to eat was $150. Not bad for a nice restaurant but not cheap for shitty service. I didn't ask for a manager and I was going to write a note to the server explaining how humiliating he made us feel. Instead I left him 20% which now I regret due to him making our time there regrettable, however as I stated before the food was impeccable and speed of service was great so I tipped based on that. However I will not be returning to this establishment due to this server and felt the need to share my experience.

Went there tonight for my birthday dinner and wasn't all that impressed unfortunately. I was really looking forward to trying the lobster ravioli and even though it's not on the regular menu they were still able to make it for me. Maybe they shouldn't have because it was such a let down to be honest. From the pictures from other people's reviews it looks so fresh and yummy with a decent amount of lobster. The tiny bit of lobster that was on mine was dry and tasteless and the portion was way too small for the price. It was also kinda bland. My boyfriend had the chicken Alfredo and his pasta was undercooked and gummy and my mom's grilled chicken was dried out. We did make a reservation since it's a Saturday and they gave us a nice table with no wait even though we were a couple mins early. Our waiter wasn't super friendly...he provided decent service though. For $100 I think we could have had a better meal and experience elsewhere so I probably won't be back.

Our party of three dined here last night. We started with the shrimp scampi as an appetizer along with a bottle of wine. We ordered one special (steak, lobster, mashed potatoes and deep fried brussel sprouts), halibut with vegetables and the penne chicken, mushroom and sun dried tomato dish as our main dishes. Everything was great!  Best of all though was the service!!  Dane was our waiter and he was great!

My boyfriend and I decided to come here tonight because we were craving spaghetti and meatballs. Our server came to take our order and was telling us about the specialty items on the menu. One of those items was king crab legs. We decided to order that and also get an order of spaghetti and meatballs.  Our food came out incredibly fast and we were incredibly happy about that. The crab legs were delicious. When we tried the spaghetti and meatballs the pasta sauce as well as the meatballs were incredibly bland. We decided to return it and get something else. The waiter brought us a bolognaise dish but ultimately it just looked like a smashed up version of the spaghetti and meatballs and practically tasted the same with a little more seasoning. We ate it anyways. We decided to order a creme brûlée for desert which was really good. We had also ordered a $25 bottle of wine with our food. When the check came we had realized our waiter failed to mention the price of the crab legs appetizer before we decided to order it and the cost for about four (not even full legs) crab legs was $65. Despite our waiter being incredibly friendly and welcoming, he still charged us for the meal we returned and did not have the decency to comp the spaghetti and meatballs or at least the desert due to our dissatisfaction. All in all our total was about $140 including a tip. I was very disappointed in the meal and what my boyfriend paid for it. It was absolutely not worth the cost. We will not be returning to this restaurant.

My family used to frequent Mastrioni's when it was at the previous location.  Unfortunately, we are no longer in Vegas as often as we'd like to be.  Fortunately, the food hasn't changed.  Sooooo delicious...  I had the Veal Piccata, which was very tender and made perfectly sautéed with lemon and capers and served with a side of penne marinara.  I also had a taste of the Cesar Salad with Anchovies.  Yummy!!!  Our waiter was great and very attentive.  Will definitely head back the next time we're in Vegas.

Great Service and great food. Priced accordingly. We've never had a bad meal here. My wife had the seafood linguine and she is picky when I comes to pasta so it passed her test. The bouillabaisse is awesome as well with plenty of spice. The cream puffs are quite tasty too.

Best Italian food I've ever had.  Hubby had the shrimp fettucine and I had the pork tenderloin.  Both were excellent.  You can dress casual but this would be a great place for a very special dinner.  Service was great, wine was fantastic.  Love, love, love this place.

It's a lovely small place; nicely decorated dim lighting for intimate dining.  The lobster ravioli was delicious -  a slight hint of mango flavor unless my taste buds fooled me.  
Staff friendly and attentive.  Decent wine list.    I had a glass of Reisling. I would definitely dine there again and try other dishes.
Parking is limited.  Seating is also limited - make a reservation.  There's a full bar and looked nice from where I was seated - for a bite to eat solo or meeting a friend.

Never have had a bad experience here.  I enjoy sitting at the bar with my friends and chatting it up with the staff.  Everyone is super friendly and they remember your name!  Pete the owner... Sweet and kind. He gets excited to share his food and at times gives out chef samples. Nothing like a chain...smaller place and cozy.  I love how all the server staff is all males! Love love love that!  The food is full of flavor... I recommend shrimp scampi and lobster ravioli. Both amazing! Appetizer sizes enough for a meal. Pretty good wine selection and they always serve bread.  Give this place a try...you'll be back for more!

I was eating out with a bunch of medical professionals (11 of us) on 05-03-2018. We all ordered our meals and some of our meals came with pasta. Mine did so when a server put the pasta in front of me I started to eat it. I was halfway through the pasta when a server told me that I had the wrong meal so he took my plate and threw the food away!!! I told the server that I did nothing wrong. I simply ate the food that was put in front of me. The server just looked at me all pissed off and said "whatever" As a result, I then asked for the manager of the restaurant. It ends up that the jerk that took my food was the manager!!! Wowza. So the jerk that screwed up the food and then took out his frustration on me was the manager of this place. I will never never never go back to this place. The manager is awful. Go somewhere else people.

My family and I came in town from LA to visit other family. We decided to stop by here for lunch. Amazing Italian!! Fast service. Food was a little hot (burned the roof of my mouth) but it was amazing. Highly recommended

Aaaaaaamazing as always. We started with the Caesar salad w/anchovies.  Perfect.  I had the Shrimp & Scallops in Vodka sauce pasta dish and the BF had the Lobster Ravioli.  Both were fantastic.   I finished the night with some delicious Tiramisu.

Came here again and had to post another pic of our salads.

So haven't been here for years so decided to try again. One of the reasons was the attitude of the staff. Well I have to say the took about two seconds as soon as I walked in. 
Host "your a little early (5 minutes) and your table isn't ready"
Me " there's all kinds of empty tables they are just sitting there who knows how long they will be"
Host " you're right let me sit your party over here"
Host a few minutes after we are all sitting and having drinks "sorry that table was reserved I need to move you over here"
Us "no way we are getting stuff in the corner give us this table"
Host "well ok". Note we moved over one whole table 

About 20 minutes later and lots of empty tables still the party who's table that he supposed sat us at partially arrives. Less than 5 minutes later they did not like that table so they moved to another. 

REALLY. WHAT THE HELL! 

Sorry bad move bad service your ass should be canned. 

Oh as far as the food it was good but I have had much better eggplant that didn't taste like bread and side pasta that was not rubbery

In town for Thanksgiving and friends suggested Mastrioni's for dinner.  The four of us had various pastas that were very good. I'm a big fan of Spaghetti Carbonara but it was not on the menu. I asked if the chef could make it for me and he kindly agreed to accommodate me. The pasta was fabulous.  Each dessert was enough for two or more people.  An enjoyable dinner and the restaurant is highly recommended.

This place is fantastic! A local told me about it when I was there on business and I've been eating here ever since. The food is always right on and the service is spot on. The guys in the kitchen know all the regulars and it seems that every time I'm there a customer makes a trip to the open kitchen to compliment the cooks. They don't have Lasagna on the menu, but if they are not slammed and you asked nicely the chef will have someone make it for you. It is so good! The Halibut Picatta  is amazing. I've never had a meal there that I didn't thoroughly enjoy. A little pricey but worth every penny. If you like watching people cook, find a seat at the bar and enjoy the show!

Great service and food at a great price. The waitress consistently checked up on us to ensure if our meal was good. The decor instead is very nice and gives it that Italian vibe. As with any Italian place, I'm a sucker for anything with carbonara as the sauce. Only thing I wish that they could work on is keeping a steady structure. It was busy so the food came out slow and so I heard and saw customers getting upset.

This place is not only very good but the staff is very friendly and considerate to any of your needs. Justin was our server and out of all the experience I've had here in Vegas he was above and beyond the best server of all. May I add that their osobucco is amazing it reminded me of my childhood thank you for such a peasant experience

Excellent Italian food. We were able to get in without a reservation. Bread was warm and fresh with a high quality olive oil and balsamic vinegar. One of us had the spaghetti with meatballs, the other the baked ziti. Both dishes were amazing! Meatballs were huge and well seasoned. Spaghetti and sauce were hot and tasty. Lots of delicious cheese on the ziti. Portions were very large; I took a box home. Service was excellent! We'll be back!

May 2017 Update:  We tried here again and unfortunately, not a great experience. Biggest issue was LONG wait for food and mediocre service. Downgrading to three stars; maybe short-staffed tonight. Food was still good.

I may have to give it another chance, but $12 For a Caesar Salad is ridiculous!
And $23 for so-so eggplant parmesan and bland side of pasta is crazy. 
It was not worth the $100 check. 
The meatballs are frozen,  reheated and not good. 
Nice atmosphere and the place was packed so I somehow missed what it's all about. 
Our service was great, so no complaints there. 
Stay tuned for an update and hopefully more stars.

Excellent!!!! Food and service was amazing!!!! We sat at the bar so we could see the kitchen and it was very impressive! The chefs were hard at work preparing mouthwatering meals! The staff was very nice and welcoming. This restaurant was by far one of the best I've ever been to in Vegas and I've been in town for 40 years!

Tried to give this place a second chance and even though the service was better the meatballs failed on this experience. The wine was great, the garlic bread yummy, but some how they were able to screw up a meatball. When the plate came to the table the meatballs looked hot and delicious but then I took a bite and wanted to spit it right out. It tasted like cardboard filler and rotten spices, maybe the meatballs had past its prime and someone forgot to check the expiration date...whatever it was it left a bad taste in my mouth. My mom also ordered the spaghetti and meatballs...she won't be back again. We tried telling someone about the meatballs but it fell on deaf ears. So I will NOT be recommending this place to anybody or giving this place a chance again.

I loved my meal here at Mastioni's. I did a seafood pasta with a vodka style sauce and came with my mom who was in town from FL.  She did a more garlic, oil type seafood pasta.  Both were awesome.  Dress nice, place is nice but doesn't break the bank.

I tried this place for the first time tonight and it was alright. Service was good, everyone was friendly and water was kept full. Going over the menu I was a little surprised to see some appetizers in the $20 range but the entrees were reasonable averaging $18-25 and a little more if you chose seafood or steak. 
I ordered the Chicken Parmigiana including  a side of fettucine with marinara sauce. It was pretty good! Large portion and perfect amount of mozzerella. However the tomato sauce was very watery and the pasta was definitely undercooked. 
My boyfriend ordered the Pork Tenderloin with apricot sauce and said the flavor was good. However, portion wise, looked pretty funny next to my chicken parmigiana. Very tiny!!  McDonald's burger patties were thicker than these tenderloin slices lol. He also had the same problem with his pasta side of being undercooked.
Honestly, I probably wouldn't come back here again since this area has tons of options but I'm glad we gave it a try.

I thought I wrote this when I posted my pics from Mother's Day. Ooops, I forgot but here goes. Everything was amazing! Being a server myself and knowing that Mother's day is one of the busiest days of the year, everything was on point! The Veal Marsala was tender and flavorful! We had a shrimp scampi appetizer that could've been a meal! My Mom ordered their version of Spumoni and it was so good she had to have a second one! We've been there several times and will be back soon!

Fantastic overall Dining experience!! Theee best oso bucco on Las Vegas!! Eggplant parm very very good too... Ask for waiter Justin D and make sure you get the homemade Cheesecake!! If my exwife made cheesecake like that I would have never gotten Divorced

Ate here Monday night with another couple from out of town. We were the first in for dinner as the place was empty at 5 pm. The inside was nicely decorated and it definitely gave out an Italian flare. We really enjoyed our meals except for their chopped salad. Very bland as the dressing could have used some help. Chicken Marsala was excellent as was their Chicken Piccata. My wife had a gluten free chicken dish with Penne and said it was terrific.  We ordered wine by the glass and really enjoyed the selections. Our server was the best and made our evening that much more enjoyable. Would definitely come back, but will skip the chopped salad. I have to also mention that when we left the place was packed!!!
Attentive, good proportions, friendly staff, good food.  Leave the gun,  take the canolli..........

We stopped here last night for a quick bite to eat. What a find! Top rate service, excellent Italian food, and the prices are not bad either. Even though its located inside a strip-mall type setting, the interior is very nicely done. Bar for a quick drink of finger food, semi-private area if you want to have a small party, and the normal tables are large enough to handle the portions. We had the shrimp cocktail (super), Palm salad (colorful, not too much dressing, just the right sized heats of palm), and the Chicken Vesuvius. Top that with a Blueberry martini which was not from some pre-mix but made from hand, and you've got yourself a fine fun meal. I'm sure their desserts are great too, but we were way too full to even try.

So, just a great place to eat and seems like a fun location to hang out. Glad we stumbled upon it.

I was lucky enough to have this place recommended to me.  The menu shown online doesn't show the extent of what they actually serve.  My friend and I were dressed informally but neatly, as were most customers.  The place has a formal but relaxing feel to it.  I had Chicken Parmesan and my guest had Chicken Francese . Both were excellent and the portions filled the dinner plates.  The waiter, Justin, was very friendly and attentive, in a reserved way.  Mixed drinks were $8 and packed a punch.  This restaurant owner has it all together.  I will go back again for sure.

I had gift certificates for this place for a while and finally cashed them in! What was I waiting for ?  Hands down THE BEST Osso Bucco I have ever had.  Our waiter Justin said it would be the best according to Chef and it was!!! Perfectly cooked, seasoned almost perfect ( I would have added Kalamata Olives ) pasta that was paired with it was perfect.  Portion was on point.  
Now back to the appetizer, a very fresh calamari with broccoli rabe and peppers, tomatoes and potatoes in a beautiful sauce.  I don't even eat octopus anymore because I discovered it was very intelligent so I made a conscious effort to stop eating them however I may have to eat that calamari once a month along with the osso bucco.
The Tiramisu was great just a bit soggy/juicy for me but great!  This place is as good as any place on the strip for Italian food. I was so impressed went and shook the Chefs hand after meal well done. Gordon Ramsay would be proud and not have much to say except "Brilliant and clearly passionate about your restaurant"

Amazing food. They squeezed us in for a reservation and accommodated my party of 8. I was so grateful since it was my dad's birthday and he wanted Italian. The veal special was for my dad and he loved it. The server, I think his name was James (a bronco fan), was so attentive and the entire staff was great. My daughter spilled her drink and they were so sweet to her and cleaned up quickly. I ordered calamari the penne with chicken, mushroom and sundried tomatoes and it was to die for. We had fettucini alfredo at the table with chicken and the sauce had so much flavor. Even the cheesecake for dessert was excellent. The o ly thing that wasn't great was the bruschetta, the tomatoes were not ripe and it could have used salt or balsamic in my opinion. But the rest was amazing!

The last time I had an Italian meal this exceptional I was in "little Italy" San Francisco. Food was hot and consistent throughout, from app to dessert. The crab cakes (loaded with crab meat) rival anything I've ever eaten in Baltimore. The veal marsala was amazing, tender and full of flavor.
Even the creme brulee was on point!
Complements to the chef!

Michael "our server" didn't miss a beat, even his wine recommendation was spot on.

I've been in Vegas for 28 year's and this is by far the best Italian seafood resturant in the valley!

Can't wait to go back, keep up the good work.

Celebrated my family's 26th wedding anniversary here tonight. Not only was the food amazing, so was the staff. So accommodating to our needs. Did whatever it takes to make sure our dining experience was nothing but amazing. I would recommend Mastrioni's to anyone that is looking for amazing food and service.

Chicken Marsala, Calamari and chocolate gelato = 5 stars.

Great local place. My husband and I dined here recently and received professional and friendly service from the wait staff. Food was tasty and although we were the last table in the restaurant, we never felt rushed. Great place to check out.
The Rigatoni Bolognese is amazing! It's my favorite dish is in this place. (Meant to post in 2012. Way delayed post.)

We were hoping to find a great Italian restaurant in Vegas, one well off the strip where the locals go. And man, did we ever find a gem! About 15 minutes from The Palms, Mastrioni's was every bit as good as any Italian Restaurant in New York. Seriously, I don't say that lightly! Our server was awesome, and the food was top-notch. The Shrimp Francese was billed as the best in Vegas, and it really was. The place was so good, we went back 2 days later for lunch.

We're not easy to please when it comes to Italian Restaurants, but we'll never do Vegas again without dinner at Mastrioini's. Don't take my word for it, see for yourself!!
A bit on the pricey side but the food was really great. Had pork tenderloin and the sauce was delicious.
Had the Bolognese, it was excellent, service was great.  Last time I went, I went for the seafood, which turned out to be boring, but the italian is spot on.  Definitely recommend.
My favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas! Love the Clams Oreganata!  The service is always great!

So I've been bugging my hubby to go to this place for like a year. And finally had the opportunity last night to go. It was amazing. The food was really good, deco was nice, the bathrooms were really clean and the service was amazing. I haven't had this great and attentive kind of service in years! The food itself was just as good if not better than most places but what got me was the fact when I was looking at the menu for desert and didn't see my fave, I told the waiter and he told me he might have one that they made and didn't put it on the menu that night. It was amazing! Probably the best creme brûlée ever! Well done!

Nice, neighborhood spot.  Decided to go with a friend for an early dinner on a weekday.  Food was just fine and atmosphere nice.  We got a bit of a shock when the bill came.  Our dinner was 2 bowls of linguini with clam sauce, one side of spinach, one glass of wine and one club sold.  The bill was almost $80!  The food and service were fine but I think they have gone a bit overboard on their pricing.  Not a value at all.

Tonight was my sisters birthday and five of us arrived at a little after 5P for dinner.  We loved every minute of it. Xalan was the server and honestly is as good as it gets with service. The other wait staff that cleared and brought food were equally as good.  As hard core old fashion Italians we loved the food! Dad-Sea Bass perfectly cooked. Mom-Baked Ziti, delicious, birthday sister Veal Parm, yummy, Sister Eggplant Parm, great and I had the Linguini and White Clams, delicious! Desert all good, yes the cream puffs incredible, the cannoli brought back memories of our from Italy Grandma, and Tiramisu great.  Wine very good. Thank you for a good meal, great service and making my sisters 21st birthday for the 31st time a special occasion for us!

My boyfriend and I dined here for my boyfriends birthday. We loved the ambiance. Sitting at the chefs counter was amazing. The kitchen is a well oiled machine and it was fantastic to watch. From the calamari to the veal parmigiana and tiramisu, everything was to die for. Kurt was on point and very knowledgable. Downfall, the pasta isn't house made and that was kinda a bummer. All in all, a great place to dine. Can't wait to return!!

Mastrioni's continues to provide excellent service and delicious food. Our server Kurt has a great personality and is knowledgeable of the menu. The Boullibasse is one of the best in Las Vegas. All of the seafood was perfectly cooked. The broth was tasty with the right amount of spice.

We are a regular at Mastrioni's, the Food is ALWAYS AMAZING!!!! Pete the owner and Chef is the BEST HANDS DOWN!!!!! The Veal Chop, the Egg Plant, Sea Food Rissoto, WOW!!! You Just Need To Go!!! Make a Reservation!!!!

Italian food is my favorite! I am always on a search for great Italian food and after all this time... I finally found one! Food was so amazing that I forgot to take pics. I finally found my linguine and clams exactly the way I love it!!! Finally finally finally someone does it right!!! Yay!!! Service was wonderful. They are on it!!!
Definitely my #1 Italian spot! Can't wait to come back and try something else off the menu...

As good as it gets for us New Yorkers out West!  I brought my wife here and we make it a point to dine here at every opportunity when we're in town.  The service and the ambiance are amazing.  We both love the pomidoro sauce.  It is the most flavorful tomato sauce I've ever had.  The seafood selections are superb:  I've had linguine with clams in the past which reminded me of back home.  This time I had one of the specials of scallops and linguine.  The scallops were yuge!  This place never disappoints.

This review is for 4.5 stars. 

Great local Italian restaurant. High quality at an affordable price. I wouldn't necessarily say it's neighborhood pricing but the portions and quality match the price and then some. Entrees range from about $17-$25 on average with meats a little pricier. Appetizers are really expensive in the $15-$20 range but are larger, family style offerings. 

We had a chicken Parmesan and a seafood penne with vodka sauce. We also had a bottle of wine for a great price and the caprese. The caprese was enormous and easily shareable - a nice starter. We ordered our entrees extra extra spicy and the chef did not disappoint. The sauces had some type of pepper that really burnt the lips - perfection. The dishes themselves were fantastic for entrees and the spice level was perfect. Props to the chef for delivering on spiciness as we hoped for. 

Mastrioni's has takeout options as well as a nice dining area with a bar and a few tvs. Staff is great and alcohol prices are very fair. Open for lunch and dinner, this place is a great local Italian option in Summerlin for a meal.

My wife and I were hooked after the first visit. The decor is very relaxing, the aroma embraces you as soon as you open the door.  We were bowled over by the Clams Oregenata...first that a place in Vegas had them, and second that they were so delicious!! The calamari was terrific as well.  The only reason that I gave it four stars instead of five was I felt the drinks were a bit over priced...$10 or $11 for a well vodka and soda was out of line, otherwise a great dining experience.

BEST Italian in Las Vegas.  The food is made fresh to order love sitting and watching them make each item at the food bar.  The food is ridiculous.  Beautiful restaurant but not over the top.  You can go in jeans but if you're headed out in a cute dress you won't be out of place.

Must tries - lobster ravioli, clams oreganato, eggplant parmesan, spaghetti and meatballs, and so much more.
Kurt was the best service we have had in a long time!  His recommendations did not steer us wrong.  The Sea Bass piccata is what we come back for time and time again!  Our new favorite spot!!

I just recently heard of this restaurant and have only been there twice, but both times were amazing! Make sure to call ahead because the restaurant is not very big so it fills up fast! First time I got the eggplant Parmesan, which was amazing but huge! Which helped my decision to share the chicken Parmesan the second trip! Definitely recommend sharing both of those dishes and if you tell them you're sharing they'll even split it for you ahead of time. For appetizer we had the crab cakes which were delicious. Crab cakes are my favorite appetizer so I order them at almost every restaurant I go to that offers them and these are definitely on the top of my list. I also had a bite of my friend's halibut which was also very delicious and the portion was more reasonable for one person. And last, but definitely not least... the dessert! I am not a big tiramisu person, not that I dislike it's just not my first pick on a dessert menu, but we were told it was a must try and it definitely was! By far the best tiramisu I've ever had! I love that the kitchen is in place of the bar, I think it makes the entire experience more personable when the chefs and the owner introduce themselves and you get to watch them prepare your dinner. It is the perfect place for a date night as it is classy but not one of those overly fancy places that make people like me feel awkward and out of place! LOL! Overall, the service, food and atmosphere are all perfect!
Wine was good. All four of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals and apps. Overall a great experience plus wonderful service.

Ambiance, food and service overall good but food is terribly overpriced- $17 for fried calamarie appetizer and $20 for a small dish of chicken parm- bread terrible for an Italian restaurant- pasta is overcooked and clams are not fresh probably from a can- reluctant to go back.

Had the seafood linguini and it was delicious. I split a side salad and good thing I did because it was giant. Others had chicken parm, giant crab lags and chicken piccata. Everyone was happy with their meals and atmosphere a plus.

First off, they were closed when we got there for a Saturday lunch. However, they were hosting a private party and said "hey, we're open so come on in". Not only did they let us in, they offered the lunch and dinner menus.

Owner (Peter) made us feel like family and the servers were incredible.

I probably don't have to mention that the food is amazing!!
This is the most underrated restaurant in Summerlin...........their food and service are first class!!
Really good food!... Nice vibe... Definitely going to be a regular.... Prices reasonable
Kurt was a blast. He's hysterical, the food was delish and if we lived here, we'd come back often!

6 of us came here for dinner and it was pretty good.
I've yet to find an italian place that is better than what I make at home, but, that's normal right?
We had several appetizers, the calamari and clams, as well as clams oreganto. It was pretty good.
For dinner, we ordered: eggplant parmesan (very good), 3 seafood and pasta dishes, ziti and meatballs, and shrimp parmesan. Everything was good, but nothing was great. Service was excellent though, which always makes a meal better.
I'd definitely come back, I did enjoy myself.

It's located in a strip mall and doesn't look like much, but the interior is sleek, modern, and beautiful. On the Sunday night we were there it was surprisingly busy with most of their tables full by 7pm.

I got one of their specials, a seafood risotto ($30) full of squid, scallops, mussels, and shrimp. There was rarely a bite without seafood. Unfortunately, it was bland and forced me to do what I rarely do in any restaurant -- reach for the salt shaker. I had to use it several times to liven up the dish. The portion size was huge, but it also lacked the creaminess of a great risotto.

If you're a fan of chicken parmagiana, the one here is bound to please with a zesty and full bodied sauce. I can't remember having a better version anywhere in town. It was accompanied by a huge side of spaghetti, which made for some great left overs the next day.

They do have a kid's menu with a few pasta options.

3.5 Stars

I'm knocking this restaurant down a star after a few more meals here since my last posting. The latest meal here was just so-so. My Palm salad was over-dressed....drenched....in oil and whatever else was in the salad dressing.  My veal Milanese was pretty good but the side of penne with marinara was terrible. Store bought pasta, for sure, cooked to a gummy, mushy texture that no serious chef would allow out of the kitchen. Awful. 

Another irritation at Mastrioni's is that when you arrive at the appointed time for your reservation...or early...or late, the hostess always, every time, says, "it will be a few minutes."  Even when the restaurant has plenty of open tables and waiters standing around looking bored.  The hostess has you wait, maybe two minutes, maybe ten, before you are seated. Why do they do this?....it's NOT something fine restaurants do. The hostess also gives off a distinctly unfriendly aura. 

One other specific complaint: when I sat down at the table on my most recent visit, the bread plate had a half used Tic Tac stuck to the plate. Disgusting, only made worse when the Seater said it looked like a tooth.  

Lots of diners there in shorts and t-shirts.....really diminishes what is positioned to be a fine dining establishment.

One final complaint.  Mastrioni's should allow reservations via Open Table. Calling for reservations in this day and age is old school and annoying.

The food and service here is always very good.  It we a little disconcerting to see the cook grab some pasta with his bare hands and throw it in the boiling water.  He handled several other food items without gloves.  I love the food here but that really disappointed me.

This place is way up there in price. Oh yeah. I am not much for Italian food, but I had the best crab legs in the world here. They were "HUGE"  So delicious. My friend is Italian and this is his favorite place. So with that said, he would know since he has traveled all over the world and has eaten at many Italian restaurants. If he rates their Italian food up there with the best then it has to be; even though I don't eat Italian Food. (I know I have to be the only one, right?)  Enjoy, but make sure you bring a whole lot of money to this one. Seriously. First class dining so you don't feel too bad going home broke.

We had a gift card we needed to use , for the longest time we've been wanting to dine at Mastrioni's , we finally made it last night and sadly to say it was extremely disappointing ... we weren't dressed to the nines nor were we ghetto .. just in between , but the look we got from the waiter was like we didn't belong ... Anyway ... we started off our dinner with calamari it was extremely bland no flavor  whatsoever , it needed some serious seasoning or something ,  the marinara sauce was just as boring ...next we order dinner I had the shrimp and scallops with vodka pasta,  it was the most boring dish ever ... ZERO flavor , do they not use salt or pepper? I mean the scallops were tasteless ... my son had the spaghetti and meatballs ... the meatballs were tough and hard like baseballs , dense and dry again no flavor ... my husband had the steak , he ordered it way too rare (for my liking ) but he said it was just ok. I think had he gone maybe med rare instead of raw  it probably would've tasted better .. the service was so so, we had cocktails after dinner , those were the best thing we had ... sorry to say we won't be returning ... I was really hoping this place would have worked out for us ... Oh well ... we'll just move on...
Superb food with a menu selection second  to none. The party is better than the invitation!

Went for the first time last night with family after my Italian cousin who recently moved here from Jersey had been a few times and recommended we take our other cousin from Jersey here to enjoy her last meal before flying back east. I am a tough critic of Italian food in Vegas and can not believe I haven't heard of this place sooner. Kurt was our waiter and he was superb! I joined the table after he took everyone else's drink order and he asked what I like and recommended a great wine. Based on his personality, I trusted his judgment. He was super friendly, understood our east coast sense of humor and made great recommendations. This is the type of place where you can tell the servers love what they do, are well trained, know the menu and have experience. Or at least this is the impression Kurt left. I can't really speak for the other servers.We had 4 kids with us and he was super patient as well. 

We ordered calamari and cheese salad as apps which were both delicious. Calamari tasted fresh with a crispy breading and tender inside, not chewy at all. Sauce was really good. For meals our table tried ziti, raviolis, meatballs, scallops, and I had the Linguini and clams in a white sauce. Absolutely delicious with a huge amount of clams. Most places tend to be stingy with the clams. I forced myself to eat every bite, as i did not want to waste any and bringing it home wasn't an option last night. The baked ziti was like what I'm used to back east that most Italian restaurants can't get right in Vegas. This place is the real deal. I tasted the scallops and they also tasted fresh and delicious.  I can't wait to go back and try the eggplant parm. I was reluctant to try it on my first visit, as I like a traditional fried, layered and baked and have not found a restaurant in town that does it the way they do in New York and Jersey. Kurt promised I'd like it, so I will be back to try that.  For dessert, we tried the tiramisu, cheesecake and kids had gelato. The tiramisu was on point. Tasted homemade and fresh! I don't really like cheesecake but this was excellent. Again, tasted very fresh and homemade. I failed to mention sooner, it's a very comfortable nice looking restaurant with a good atmosphere. The bar area looks very nice as well. It's a good sized place with enough room for several large tables, but small enough to feel cozy, like a neighborhood family owned restaurant.

Service was great! We had crab cocktail it was good but not enough crab . Also had the meatballs and they were amazing and big . I had the lemon and capers with sea bass . And it was one of the best dishes I have ever had !

Super cute authentic Italian food in Orange County. The decor is very homey & service is extremely attentive! The owners make you feel like family and make sure you are taken care off throughout your whole dining experience! Everything is homemade & you can def taste the difference. We saved room for dessert & it was well worth it! The cheesecake & tiramisu was delish!! Save room for either or both, homemade perfection!! Very reasonably priced & cute for a inexpensive date night.

Fabulous-- and if lucky enough to get Kurt as your waiter-- even better.  Get the gnocchi.  Best I've ever enjoyed.  The atmosphere- the location! Just the best.  Will go back again and  again!!  Wonderful for special occasions!

I used to love this place. Recommended it to several friends and suggested this place for dinner last night with a friend. The service was horrible. Our servers name was Kurt. When my friend asked about the pricing of a bottle of wine, he said sarcastically "what does it say on the menu?" Really? Are you in the service industry? That was the first interaction we had with him. Then she asked if the bartender made a good Long Island Ice Tea.. he said "I wouldn't know." I've never had a server be so rude. I will never return or recommend. The food quality was also poor. Had the Penne Chicken Spinach. It was drenched in a sweet sauce. Barely touched it.

Went here for the first time on Monday. Food was phenominal - had the grilled Sea Bass that was excellent. Well prepared with a touch of olive oil.  Dominic was our waiter/server who went well beyond the call and provided excellent explanations, service, and brillant customer attention. Well done - we shall return!

Baked ziti to die for! Great service. Atmosphere is very nice. You wouldn't know from the outside how nice this place is. Our side dish with our entree was the garlic oil penne! So good. I ordered the veal picatta. Wouldn't order again it but preparation was very good.

We came here for a family dinner last night. Overall, everything was fine; nothing exceptional, nothing poor. My Veal Picatta was bland, I like a zesty burst of lemon, garlic and wine in that dish. This preparation was buttery as the foremost flavor. My husband had Linguini with Sausage and again the main impression was that it was a bit bland; mild sausage. The rest of the party had basically the same opinion with their pasta dishes (spaghetti and ravioli). Taste, texture and serving size all okay. Service was good.

I brought my friend to Mastrioni's for lunch on her birthday. Kurt took excellent care of us. He was attentive and delightful. The Caprese Salad was beautiful and tasty. The sea bass was delicious, tender and cooked to perfection. I love to bring friends and clients to Mastrioni's because the food, service and atmosphere are consistently exceptional.

This is a long over due review. My family is from Italy. This is the best Italian food! I never eat meatballs out because I'm always disappointed, Mastrioni's are the real deal! Tender,flavorful and cooked to perfection. Their seafood pasta is amazing....tender clams, mussels and calamari. Shrimp and scallops cooked perfectly.  Great harmony of flavor. The eggplant parm is the best in town! The atmosphere is inviting and the service was excellent ! I always look forward to dinner there and I'm happy when I leave!

Second time here and it keeps getting better! First, the service is outstanding, our needs were anticipated at every point. The salads were fresh with just the right amount of dressing. The linguini and clams had the perfect amount of sauce and spice, pasta was to the tooth. Highly recommend and a must every time we visit Vegas.
Just went here last night with friends and what a treat!  Food is exceptional and service was terrific!  I would highly recommend this wonderful place to anyone!

Great Italian close to home. Service has been great for the most part. Food has always been amazing. Their warm bruschetta is a favorite. Osso Buco is fantastic, just not always on the menu. Perfect date night spot.

In Vegas for a trade show and a "foody" friend who lives here suggested we go "off the strip". Coming from Miami where there are many great restaurants, Mastrioni's did not disappoint. Dominic our waiter, straight out of Brooklyn, is the brother of the chef/owner. He "knew his stuff". I had 2 appetizers, both were specials and my dinner companion had an incredible seafood salad to start and linguine with clams for his entree. Wine menu had well priced selections. Espresso fudge pie for dessert completed a most delicious meal.

You should be embarrassed of yourself. You took my money for a gift card and never produced the gift card since January. Still waiting. 2 1/2 months my friend is waiting for her happy birthday gift card. You keep telling me you're sorry, apologizing, and that you're looking into it. Terrible customer service. If it were me I would have immediately issued the gift card to the customer- period- then looked into what ever trouble was causing this in your company. Pathetic.

First off, Italian food is probably my favorite type of meal to eat 5 days out of the week!! A buddy of mine that's Italian and from New York told me that this was the place to eat some real Italian food so of course knowing where he is from I took his word for it. Definitely delicious and we'll worth the cost. We had the shrimp cocktail, beef carpaccio, spaghetti and meatballs and the rigatoni pasta with meat sauce, and cheese cake of course. 
 I tried everything we ordered and loved everything but the beef carpaccio. The shrimp were fresh and huge, loved the horseradish it came with. The beef carpaccio was Ok,  I have had better. The spaghetti and meatballs and that was awesome, the meatballs were tender and juicy.  I absolutely loved my rigatoni pasta though, it was full of flavor and the portion size was huge!! The cheesecake is made in house and was amazing!  
I have never had authentic Italian food that i know of (lol) but i wohld think that this was because of how fantastic it was!! Service was excellent and fast!! Definitely one of my new favorite spots!!

I've been coming here for about ten years now so it feels like home. It's family run and owned and they are always so warm. The food is tremendous. The gallery of painted art on the wall is beautiful, I bought I piece for my living room there and it has been on my wall for 5 years and looks amazing. Thanks guys

I can't get enough of the delicious food, and friendly staff. The extensive wine list is another reason I love this place! 

There's always a debate between which appetizer to get, there are so many good ones! On nights likes tonight, when I am not feeling seafood, I order the bruschetta appetizer. The best bruschetta I have ever had. Ever. I usually do the clam oregenate, crab cakes, or seafood salad!

I had the Penne, Chicken, Mushroom, and Sun-dried tomatoes. It is probably my favorite pasta dish, of all time. I also really love their Penne, Shrimp and Scallop Vodka. 

My friend chose the delicious Ribeye, cooked to a perfect medium rare. I kept stealing the parmesan potatoes that came with it. 

For dessert, we shared a scrumptious slice of homemade cheesecake and Creme brûlée. Because who can resist mouth-watering, fluffy, perfect cheesecake?!

Definitely a must try! They get busy on the weekends, but are usually good about quickly seating you. I still recommend making a reservation 

They offer catering and have a room available for private parties, along with family style menu options for parties of 16+ guests 

PS
The food comes out fast, fresh, and hot!

This is my favorite Italian restaurant on the Westside. It has Strip pricing. You will see some of the city's notable personalities here. Semi-casual dress. Don't go in jeans unless you drive a Maybach, wear a mortgage on your wrist and face is on tv.
Fabulous seafood linguini, eggplant Parmesan and several others and the atmosphere is upbeat and relevant!

So torn on this review and this place...2 1/2 stars. 

Most of the food was delicious. The service was horrendous. It is way overpriced. 

I had pasta fagioli soup. ($8) There was not one single piece of pasta in it. Hmmm...what a misnomer? Regardless, it was hot and flavorful. Hubby had linguini and clams. ($22) I had a shrimp and scallop vodka pasta. ($26) My pasta was cooked perfectly and it was nicely seasoned. Very good. My pet peeve, happens all the time, is that I had to dig my fingers into my pasta with red sauce, while wearing white, to surgically remove the tails from my shrimp. It is not appropriate. The customer should not have to do the food prep on this. Remove tails. My girlfriend ordered sea bass ($35). It was totally mushy and improperly thawed. She did say the spinach was tasty though. 

Our dirty dishes sat on the table for the entire meal. We asked multiple times for bread. We never got more water. Our server never checked on us and our food. Service was poor. 

The price point makes no sense for a neighborhood Italian place. 

Expect tasty food but expect to pay more than it's worth. Maybe service was a fluke. The table next to us was equally as irked. They cancelled their food and were visibly upset with the server. 

Needless to say, I won't return.

Mastrionis is without a doubt, one of the best and most hidden gems in all of Las Vegas, especially for Italian food. My wife and I have been coming here for special occasions including wedding anniversaries.

This place is easy to drive by, as its smack dab in the middle of a little row of businesses and could easily be overlooked like a typical deli or subway from the outside, and it's tinted windows make it difficult to see inside.

Once inside however, this place is very classy. It's well lit with a well dressed and well mannered staff.

The first time we went, for appetizers my wife ordered the bruschetta which was incredibly flavorful and obviously prepared fresh.  She insist it's some of the best she has had. I myself took the opportunity to order the crab cakes, which I am always hesitant to do as most places typically delivery small cakes that are not worth it. At mastrionis however, the crab cakes I got were large in size and full of flavor, a must have for any fan of crab cakes.  In addition to this the restaurant also serves bread with olive oil and balsamic which is just a great way to start your meal.

For dinner we again tried something different, I myself ordered the fettuccini Alfredo and added the shrimp to it.  The pasta had a rich creamy flavor with a thick sauce that can never be accused of being watered down. The shrimp were big and fresh and added that seafood taste to my dish that I was craving.  My wife ordered the Parmesan chicken, which was also large in size and fantastic tasting. You could actually taste the seasoning and flavor in the chicken instead of just a mouth full of bread. The dish also came with a side of pasta with a home made marinara sauce that was just outstanding.  

Pros: a very romantic atmosphere for a date but also very family friendly. It's got a darker interior which I personally enjoy. Outstanding food, some of the very best I have had in Vegas or California. After eating here you'll likely never step foot into a chain like Olive Garden again.  This place also has generous portions on the plates and appetizers we have tried here.

Cons: Pricing. A dinner salad will run $10 which despite excellent flavor seems a little steep.  Adding shrimp to my pasta was about $4 I believe which felt a little high considering the amount they give.  This alone was the only thing preventing 5 stars.  When we went the first time we ordered two appetizers, tow salad, two meals and two drinks which ran us $100+. Salads should not be more than $5 and a few of the appetizers should be a couple bucks less.

This restaurant is, without question, the BEST, local Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. Beside the consistency in quality dishes, the relaxed atmosphere is upbeat and fun! The owner, Pete, is truly a seasoned and professional restaurant owner with the touch of "Wacky" that keeps the local fans coming back time and time again. The food is second to none, you are NEVER disappointed. The service is outstanding and the prices are very fair! For a special treat, order the Mastrioni salad and if you really want a taste of heaven, order the Caprise salad with peaches.

My son and I went for an early dinner. There were two others at 5pm. I had high hopes after reading the good reviews but was disappointed. My son ordered a regular Bolognese with spaghetti noodles. His meal was good, nothing to rave about but decent. I ordered the seafood past at $29. It was a good portion that would fill you up. There were two large shrimp and 4 clams and 4 mussels in their shell. Then the filler was tiny squid. All of this looked great, but I've never had such a poor dish. Either they forgot the wine in the white sauce or there was too much water in the pasta... I don't know which but the white sauce tasted like buttered water and nothing else. It was quite disappointing. And I was starving so just about everything should have tasted good, but after this dish, I have decided that I'm not trying it again. My son's spaghetti plus mine was $50 without gratuity... Sure the waiter agreed to make me something else, but if you have the most expensive pasta dish delivered without any taste... why would I want to try anything else...Not going back.

My husband and I live right down the street from this restaurant and never thought to stop by, but my brother was in town for a business trip And we decided to come by for dinner! Everyone was so nice from the moment we walked in the door. It was myself,  my brother and my 16 month old daughter. Our server wss Kurt and he was great! We had the shrimp scampi to start, my brother had the grab legs which were amazing!!! I had the grilled salon and my daughter had the penne marinara with a meatball. We all loved our selections and I plan on taking guests to this hidden gem every time they are in town!! We will be back again for sure! Thanks again Kurt for your great service and being so friendly with my daughter!!

Just sat down with a to go order from here. I know first hand how some to go orders suck when you get them home. 
Not from here!! 
Omg! My salad is fresh and crisp with no wilted lettuce what so ever! Lots onions and tomatoes. The salad is big enough to share. 
The Salmon Piccata is cooked perfectly, salmon isn't over cooked, perfect amount of lemon and capers!
I just couldn't wait to start eating and I forgot to review my vegetable medley, they were perfect!

When the food came out, everything looked very unappetizing. My boyfriend's and I's entrees are probably the mist decent looking ones. My cousin literally got a gigantic slab of meat and that's it. No sides, just a slab of meat. Lol

HOWEVER, once you try the food, it is delicious. Kind of like the saying goes: don't judge a book by it's cover.  Everything is well seasoned and very fancy. One of my cousin had only four shrimps on his plate and that was the entire entree. Haha??? 
At least the food was good though!
Great food very good service price was high but food was good the wine real pricey   You be better off drinking wine before dinner somewhere close by

This restaurant came highly recommended, and did provide a competently prepared meal. I enjoyed the chicken parmigiana although the accompanying pasta proved only satisfactory.  I read promising reviews of the lasagna, but they were not serving it that night, which appears to occur regularly. The service was adequate, not exemplary, and I noted they abandoned my group when they were ready for us to leave.  The thirst was memorable. Overall an adequate restaurant, but not living up to the reputation I had heard. Fortunately the company was better, more pleasant, and more memorable than the meal.

I ordered the rigatoni bolognese, the pasta is from box and not fresh. I guess I shouldn't be surprised since it doesn't state fresh pasta anywhere. It was very disappointing. Taste worst then when I make it at home. Meat sauce was watery as well. Will not be coming back.

This place was great! I'm use to looking for restaurants on the strip when trying a new place, but this was a great choice. The shrimp and scallop vodka sauce pasta was delicious. Everyone in my party enjoyed their dish. I recommend Mastironi's to anyone who loves pasta and wants to stay off the strip!

Huge fan of the food & the wait staff.  The management needs a lesson in customer service. 

Service was awesome...A+.  someone was always available to clear away, refresh drinks, serve, offer condiments or check on us in general.  

The food was also spectacular.  Didn't care for the desserts, so only an A.   We split a salad (they kindly plated it in the back so no embarrassing scooping of food at the table!) and there wasn't a green morsel left. My husband loves spaghetti & meatballs and theirs didn't disappoint!  I had the scallops & they were delish!!   Like I said, desserts didn't wow either of us.  

I wanted to briefly speak to the manager on duty about hosting a dinner for 45 people every quarter, but she was too busy to speak to me (no lie...that's what they told me) & the waiter brought some copies of menus with a handwritten name of who to call.  My husband said he'd like for the waiter to mention to the manager that we'd really like to speak to her very briefly...less than 2 minutes (to compliment the staff...we decided not to hassle her w/ the large party conversation).  The waiter came back & told us she said it could be a while...like 20-25 minutes or more.  I was speechless.  Granted they were busy, but what manager on duty doesn't have time for a customer....especially one wanting to give more business &/or compliment the wait staff.  Left w/ a very icky feeling & decided it was not a place I would entrust to do my quarterly employee awards dinner.  Their loss...there are tons of restaurants in LVNV w/ good food, good wait staff AND good managers!!

Went there with friends after basketball practice- wow great food. It was very busy on Friday night but the flavor was still great!

We will be back for sure- I could see our Family becoming regulars! 

We tried numerous items from the menu and none of them disappointed!

I wouldn't guess it from the exterior, but Mastrioni's occupies a beautiful space. It's located in a strip mall and has the typical stucco outside. But on the inside the restaurant has high ceilings dedicated only to open air. The tables are nicely spaced apart and set with linens, art on the walls. Super classy. 

I really want to like this place, but the food wasn't so great. I went with a couple friends for lunch. I think out of all of the entrees we ordered, mine was the best. I got the Shrimp and Scallop Vodka Pasta ($17). I am a sucker for a vodka sauce and this dish didn't disappoint. The scallops were cooked perfectly: to a supple tenderness, not overdone. And the scrimps were shelled all the way to the tail. I love that. The dish had a nice balance was nicely portioned. 

My bf got the Veal Marsala ($16). I had a taste of the sauce and - holy crap (in a bad way). It  was way too sweet. My first thought was pancake syrup. 

My mom got the Pork Tenderloin ($15), which she said was not so tender. She said the gravy was very tasty and hearty, but so hearty that she could barely taste the pork. Well, hot damn. 

Both my mom and bf got a side of spinach with their entree. I thought the spinach was pretty salty. I love salt, but I love balance more. 

They played smooth jazz -- Buble and Sinatra -- during our stay.  

They tout a full bar. My mom ordered a Long Island Ice Tea. My bf noticed they only serve three Italian reds by the glass. Seems a bit under par for an Italian joint. 

Mastrioni's is a nice place to chill and the service was great. But the food wasn't good enough to make me want to return. 

#offthestrip #noncasino
Excellent service and top notch food. We had 5PM reservations and thank God we did. By 5:30PM the place was just about full. Servers were super attentive even during that busy hour.
We visited for an early lunch, service and food was delicious. Portions are just right. It's a bit overpriced but I would definitely keep this one my list of Italian places I would visit again.

I LOVE this restaurant!!! The absolute best Italian restaurant I have been to in Las Vegas!!! Great food, Great staff, Great atmosphere.  You can see them cooking the food at the bar... I have seen people walk up and ask how things are cooked and the cooks are really nice and answer the questions. If you go, you need towalk to the bathroom and seethe history of the Chef.  He is really great!! I wish I could find something that I do not like about this restaurant but there is nothing, well actually I wish it was closer to my house but I do not mind the drive for such great food!!!

Consistently fantastic food and service!  The chilled seafood salad is to die for and the bouillabaisse is as good as it gets!  We are definitely regulars!

Upscale casual dining filled with locals.  Well mannered kids are fine here but this isn't Olive Garden or Chucky Cheese.

First time was amazing! Second time was sad and depressing! I felt like I was in a very snobby restaurant and that my kind wasn't welcome which come to think about it, what is my kind anyways? Staff was rude and quite frankly allows other well to do customers to run the restaurant. Had to relocate due to some morons that interrupted our dinner then it was made out to be our fault that we had to move. Food was ok but nothing special! Plenty of other great Italian places to goto in this town without the attitude and making us feel like crap! Will never come back!

We came for Valentines's Day dinner and were so glad we did.  It's easy to see what all the hullabaloo is about. This place is gooood.

We made reservations and arrived 10 minutes early.  It being Valentines's Day we knew that it would probably be a little bit crazy getting seated.  There was a little confusion and we waited a bit longer than expected but they were very quick to remedy the situation.

The service here is excellent. Our server was Vince and he was awesome. Super attentive and polite, couldn't ask for better :) 

I ordered the chilean sea bass, bruchetta style...holy cow, it was amazing! Husband ordered the surge and turf, which he said was a little more charred than he would have preferred, but it was a ridiculously busy night for them, so we understand. When we brought it to their attention, again they were quick to remedy with a fabulous dessert. We picked the cheesecake (really really good), but since we devoured dinner there's wasn't anymore room and we took it home.  

Very nice dinner for just the two of us or with a group of friends. High ceilings, big open room, small bar that you can order food at in the back. A little pricey, but worth it.  We'll definitely be back soon.

Not impressed at all. Expected good Italian food for the price and given reputation, but I was disappointed to say the least. I can cook Italian better that that on my worst night.
We had the pasta with clams, not like others world class chefs make in Las Vegas.

Atmosphere: Dressy. 
Perfect spot to take a loved one. 
Favorite Item: Literally everything, but if I have to narrow it down, I love the crab cakes. 

Mastrioni's is amazing, our waitress Jenna was spectacular she was extremely helpful and kind. If I could I would eat here everyday.

After a massage at Massage Nirvana we went here for dinner. Very comfortable atmosphere, yet VERY nice; upscale seating but comfortable attire is a-ok (as we were in cute sweats and tanks). The front house, busser, waiter- EVERYONE very kind and warm. 

We were never rushed, which we are used to so it was shocking when our waiter asked if we were ready to fire our entree- awesome!

The food is amazing, I've worked at high-end Italian and this place is just as good if not better. Very generous with the bread, we got the Key Lime Pie Martini(and a Peach Martini, she preferred the K.L.P) and Very Berry Martini- both were delicious. 

House salads as appetizers, I got the balsamic which I found perfectly balanced. And I got the pasta with red sauce and sausage, my friend went a lil healthier and got pasta and broccoli, though her plate was good, well, mine was heaven. Even though we were stuffed (large portions) we got Cheesecake and the Tiramisu. Well, the tiramisu was light and fluffy- tasted like they had just made it, and the cheesecake was rich and yummy. 

The plates average 15-18 (nicer meals like Veal is higher 25-30), price is fitting for the food, the bill was about $120- worth it!

This is the place for my pasta (or seafood) kick when I am visiting Las Vegas.

Really good food. We ( seven of us) came for my wife's birthday and when we pulled in my sister hugged me and said this place was her favorite. Ha ha
Shrimp parm was really good and the shrimp cooked perfectly. Only downside was our server.... She was absent most the time and absent minded even more. Forgot my nephews soda and the high chair. Has to ask twice for both. Then when it was time to get the check, she was at someone else's table for what seemed like 5 minutes
Had the Sauted Halibut with Lemon & Capers.  Nice portion, well prepared.  Spinach and Vegetables were outstanding. Look Fwd to returning.

I had a hard time choosing the rating for this place since I had mixed feelings about the food and service. When I walked in there was no hostess at the stand. A waiter came to greet us and said someone would be right over. No one really came? Finally got seated after a while. The people behind me were irked that no one came to greet them and asked how long I was waiting.

Appetizers: eh
sauteed calamari- thought I'd give this a try since you don't really see sauteed calamari on menus. comes in red or white wine sauce. The calamari was OKAY. wasn't great, wasn't bad, just slightly chewy. We ordered white wine and i SWEAR the waiter said he was going to bring a side of the red wine sauce for us to try but no such sauce appeared. The sauce was so plain and so watery. It literally tasted like they made this great sauce and poured water on it to spread it a little further. When I ordered this dish I imagined I would be able to dip the bread in the sauce. would NOT recommend
caprese- this was good. no place can really mess this up. they also give you oil and balsamic vinegar on the side to top it.

Entrees: ordered all the specials
seafood risotto- i enjoyed this dish it was filled with seafood. It came with about 4 large shrimp, lots of calamari, scallops, mussels, and peas. after eating the sauteed calamari i was calamaried out. this had a lot of calamari in it. there were also a fair amount of peas, if you don't like peas better ask for it to be left out. it was perfect! came piping hot, not TOO creamy and just the right amount of flavor. would order again! eating my leftovers for breakfast!!
