lobster ravioli- after all the hype via yelp we had to try the lobster ravioli and boy did it deliver. the ravioli was delish!! it was also sprinkled on top with more lobster chunks. the noodle was made with spinach or mushroom or something (the ravioli was striped) and a little bigger than the traditional square, more like a rectangle.  ate everything and then wiped up the sauce with bread. SLURP.
bone-in veal- i didn't try this but my friend ordered it. He said it was alright and didn't seem impressed. he enjoyed the other two dishes more.

Dessert: 
Cannoli- I loveeeeeeee cannolis and I haven't found a GREAT cannoli to rave about in Vegas. this order came with two, but not that great. would not order again
Sauteed banana gelatto- this was... just banana gelatto. good but i was expecting more from the name. maybe like chunks of banana or something in it?

Overall they did a a good job with the entrees. The desserts and the appetizers are ones to forget. The waiter took our bread basket away to get more and then we had to ask for it 3 times to get it back. We ordered a specific year for our wine and was brought the incorrect one. Also the clientele there that evening were dressed very.... minimal... Not something you'd expect at an off the strip restaurant. Something to consider for those with children. I'm coming back to this place but going straight to the entrees on the specials!

The three stars is for the awesome interior design of the restaurant and the friendly staff! Now let's get to the food, the description of the pork dish gave me a beautiful visual but when I got it it was a nightmare. Paper thin slices of pork and three table spoons of mixed veggies and they didn't clean the green beans properly. It was flavorless and a disappointment. My partner got a side of pasta marinara and it was undercooked and had no salt or pepper, no life. I gave this place a try but I will stick to Nora's because they have standards.

Came here for a early dinner and they were expanding half the restaurant. (Business must be good). I had thought this was a cafe since i have driven by it but it turns out to be a a little more upscale than thatt. The decor is modern and trendy. They start you off with hot french bread dipped in oil and balsamic vinegar. I had the house salad which was not worth the $8 price tag. There was no meat, just field greens, tomatoes, onions and dressing. My bf had the spaghetti with meatballs which the sauce was extremely runny with no flavor. The rigatoni bolognese and theseafood pasta with vodka sauce looked like much better options.
Food is OK but expensive.  They are open for lunch but again lunch menu is pricy.  Service is good.

Just ate at one of my favorite places in the entire valley again. The food is always great. The ambiance is great on the inside, even though it is in a nondescript strip mall. The service was great as usual. Thanks Garrett. I highly recommend this place.
Staff service is a 10. You don't have to wait on anything, and they'll bring more bread before you run out. The food is great and not a pinch short on spices. I'll be back.

This strip mall location Italian restaurant has some really incredible food! We came on a Sunday evening and they were busy! I was glad that I had called earlier in the day to make my reservations.
We started with the Fried Calamari, it was good, not great, but was prepared well and was fresh.
Our Entrees, on the other hand, were great!
My husband had the Osso Bucco. This was so good! Fall of the bone tender, flavor for days with a delicious 'gravy' over linguini.
My Entree was on the guidance of our waiter, Kurt. I told him I wanted spaghetti, that spaghetti is one of my favorite foods and I  was hoping their version would "wow" me.
Kurt suggested I get the Spaghetti with Meatballs, substitute the marinara for the bolognese and get it spicy. He said a lot of their "regulars" order it like this.......
He was right on point, one of the best spaghetti dinners I have ever had!

Ambience: 5 stars. Quality: 5 stars. Staff: 5 stars. Only reason why I'm giving this place 4 stars is because of how expensive the place is and the quantity of the plate. I ordered the Lobster Ravioli for $25 and only got maybe about 6 pcs. Sad to say I wasn't even full. My bf got the Veal Milanese for about $26. You get 3 pcs of thinly sliced veal with a side of pasta. Very good and juicy but same thing, just not filling. Would probably not come back just because it's to expensive.
Great food in the Summerlin area. Specials are always really good. Sit at the bar by the kitchen fun to see the action. Want Italian then this is your place.

Been a few years since I've been by, but they're going strong. Busy Saturday night was bustling and very nice. The kitchen does seem to take awhile - so try not to fill up on bread, lol. 

Caesar salad pretty good. The bits of anchovy are optional, and ideally, I like to be entrusted with the whole fish. Still, it's better with than without. 

The tomato basil soup is good and very rich. I like it, though I think it sets the tone for a heavier meal. 
The pasta fagioli wins a less-complicated endorsement. 

Entrees: I tried and loved a mushroom risotto with bay scallops. Crimini and more mushrooms were good, not overwhelming at all. The risotto was perfectly cooked (though not very hot temperature-wise), and the scallops were delicious. Orbs of oceaniac joy are beached atop the risotto.

Desserts: Let's definitely talk cannoli. Hard shell, good crunch with perfect ricotta filling and stuffed with chocolate almost-chips. Better than chips.

Party also had and enjoyed the tiramisu, but I was otherwise engaged, and will simply have to take their word for it.

Hats off to the servers, who do a great job. Loved that the Front Waiter steered me in the direction of a wine I wanted -- not the one he might have necessarily wanted to sell. Cheapest of the Sauvignon Blanc, and it was delicious (Sea Glass from Santa Barbara).

Call ahead for the busier nights and times, if this recent Saturday night is any indication.

WOW... a little disappointing... We (3) went for dinner on Wed., the 26th;  the "hostess" didn't know what the heck to do with us...  the service was fair, and the food... ...We ordered 4 entrées... the great and famous Lobster Ravioli in cream sauce was salty... the sauce, that is... I wondered if it was bisque out of a can...  Did I guess right, Mastrioni?  The meatballs were flavorless...  too much breadcrumbs in them...  and the sauce on them was almost just canned tomatoes.  Not horrible,  ...most folks would like the food, I guess, 'cause they do a lot of business...  it is certainly a cut above most...

Louise R.

My boyfriend took me here for date night and I am so happy he did.  The service was fantastic.  Kurt, our waiter, described the specials to us before we ordered our bottle of Hangtime Pinot Noir.  Kurt made everything sound delicious! We chose the grilled calamari special with veggies; that was amazing! It was so tender! My boyfriend wanted the veal chop but they had just ran out (hence the 4 stars) so he went with the veal Marsala and that was delicious.  I had the seafood linguini combo (mussels, clams, scallops, jumbo shrimp).. Very tasty and it didn't taste like the ocean (salty). We ended our meal with their homemade creme brûlée and a McCallan liquor. I definitely recommend this spot.  Great food and service!
First time here tonight and it was amazing.   Scallop special was to die for and service was wonderful.

This is one of the best Italian restaurant I've been too since I've been to...sever was on point and the food amazing. I recommend this place to a couple of my coworkers and they loved it there. It had a great ambience and also very casual. Will go back again.
Love this place! I live very far from Mastrioni's and the Summerlin area, but it's worth it for the food. I had the salmon, and it was AMAZING. A five-star experience all the way.

I was in Vegas visiting family and they told me that I NEED to try this place, so we decided to go there for a Sunday dinner. This place is new nice looking restaurant in a plaza with plenty of parking. We arrive around 5:00 PM and the place was pretty empty, but by 5:45 PM it was completely filled, so you might want to make reservations before going. The service at the restaurant is great, the staff is friendly and welcoming and seems like they will do their best to meet you needs, one person in the group tends to be really picky about things and the staff had zero problems with meeting his requests.  Anyways on to the food, we ordered a total of 4 dishes


Osso Buco served on Fettuccine (5/5 stars) - This item was one of the specials and it was one of the most amazing dishes I ever had, the meat was so soft and tender. it just fell off the bone.  They also provided a small fork so that you can get to the bone marrow or the bone.  it was a little pricey ($45), but well worth it! so I would still give this dish 5/5 stars. It is big enough to share, but DON'T! its too yummy.

1/2 Baked Lobster topped with crab meat, served with papperdelle with seafood sauce (4/5 Stars) - This was also one of the specials, it consisted of a a whole Maine lobster that was split in half, topped with crab meat. The pasta it came with was a seafood sauce that contained clams and shrimp.  All of the seafood was top notch and really fresh. This dish was really good, but didn't stand out as amazing to me. but still worth the $42 price tag.

King Crab Legs (4/5 Stars ) - This dish consisted of 6 mersus sections of the crab leg. which is the largest part of it between the body and the first joint. The Kitchen does most of the work and cracks the shell and the correct point so that you can pull the whole section of meat out without much effort.  The meat its self was VERY fresh, the meat was sweet and soft like it should be. Not dry and briny like a lot of places serve. It is hard to find crab of this quality in most places.  Overall though, don't get this dish if you are really hungry, it is not a lot food for most people, I would say split this as an appetizer. (i don't remember the price)

Cioppino (3.5 stars) - I should start by saying that I this is a dish that I always compare to the best cioppino i've ever had which is at Sotto Mare in San Francisco. This dish was good in terms of quantity and seafood quality. The pasta was also cooked perfectly.  But I felt the dish was a little watery over all, I prefer to have it be a little thicker.  The taste also wasn't as flavorful as I had hoped. This dish was just "ok" for me, I don't think I would order it in the future. The cost was $34 i think or maybe $32?


Overall, I really like this restaurant.  I have added it to my must eat at again list the next time I am in Vegas.  If you are looking for somewhere to eat away from the strip I strongly recommend this place, and if they have the Osso Buco get that!!!  I am basing my 5/5 rating mostly on the Osso Buco that I ordered as well as the service.  But from eating everything I don't think you will be dissappointed with anything you order

Love this place! Been here before with my best friend and had the osso buco and it was just as good as I remembered it! Best osso buco in town I think! My family and I sat in Kurt's section and he is just the sweetest! He made excellent recommendations, joked with us, and just an all around great person and waiter. Oh also had the cream puffs for dessert, don't miss out on those, they are just to die for!

I was pretty excited to try something new and within five miles of my house. We had friends over and decided to order take out. My hubby was jonesing for some pasta, I thought this would be perfect! The pics and reviews on Yelp were favorable, so I thought.. So, I may have had an extensive order, but the hostess repeated everything correctly, so I thought we'd be good. I ordered two appetizers, garlic bread and crab cakes. One fettuccine Alfredo, lobster ravioli, veal Parmesan, and baked ziti.. first of all, we immediately took everything out of the bag upon our return home to find that our $20 crab cake app was missing.. I called the restaurant and the gal (Stephanie) apologized. I'm sorry, but a simple sorry doesn't cut it. I told her we'd be right back to pick it up.. My husband went inside after driving all the way back and she didn't offer anything for her mistake, not even an apology to him. He mentioned having to drive another almost 10 mile round trip back and she said he could get a free crab cake next time we dine in. Hmmmm thanks. My husband tipped this girl to simply place our food in a bag, but that couldn't even be done correctly.. So, 15-20 minutes later we get back to the house... all of the dinners are basically lukewarm by now. The garlic bread was inedible. I tried one piece and practically broke my tooth it was so overdone. The lobster ravioli was ok..it was packed kinda weird...the meat was cold and separate from the ravioli and sauce..it was also very fishy. The veal parm was pretty good, I'll give be them that.. the fettuccine Alfredo was not great..it was basically buttery noodles, not an Alfredo by any means... the baked ziti was probably the most basic yet decent dish we ordered. I may give them another chance, we do have the crab cake credit to redeem...but it won't be anytime soon...

The food here is very good. I would give them 5 stars but the atmosphere is a little stale. The pasta fagioli soup is amazing. Their fish selection is impressive too. Service was above averagel reasonably priced wine selection.

Excellent meal for our anniversary. I would describe Mastrioni's as an upscale version of your typical family Italian joint. They have typical preparations like piccata and marsala with higher end ingredients like veal, salmon and seabass. They have classics like pasta and meatballs and alfredo so if you want the classics they'll have something you can sink your teeth into.

That said they have a very nice contemporary and comfortable restaurant. The night we were there we saw prom goers dressed in tuxedos and dresses as well as the well healed and well dressed crowd of Summerlin. You would feel comfortable there in slacks and a button down shirt or even nice jeans. You may feel self conscious in golf shorts and a t-shirt.

The food was tasty and there was plenty of it. We shared the crab cakes which came out in a pair and could have been an entree they were so big. They had a nice balance of lump crab and not a lot of filler. 

My wife had the shrimp and scallop penne with vodka sauce. That's a creamy tomato based sauce. She loved the fact that they had taken the tail off of the shrimp. Both of us shake our heads at shrimp tail shells. Take them off restaurant people!

I had a side of fettuccine alfredo and my main course was veal marsala. The veal was tender and came in a nice sauce that wasn't too thick. There were four  large cutlets and the typical mushrooms. The alfredo was creamy and decadent with shards of fresh parmesan on top. It was well seasoned and just what I was craving.

Unlike a lot of casual Italian restaurants, Mastrioni's has a nice wine list. There are plenty of wine by the glass choices and prices are more reasonable then the strip so drink up.

We were so full we passed on desserts, but a few chocolaty gooey things went by that we might need to try on another visit!

As good as it's ever been. We found this place when it was at the Rio, loved the home feel the place and the food was dynamite, especially the meatballs. Now it's at the Paris hotel they kind of lost their home town feel but the food is just as delicious. The hostess was a bit rude but Raymond and Francisco more then made up for it. Great place to eat when in vegas, don't decide what to order until you hear the specials.

I've driven by this place many times and from the facade one would never guess how elegant the decor is inside. A hidden gem.  The service and food was very good.  A perfect little date night local, or simply wanting a quiet little elegant dining experience but without the huge cost or drive to the strip.  I would recommend semi-casual to dressy attire to match the decor and dining experience.

This place is a must for locals and tourists alike. I've been here multiple times, with friends, date nights, and with the whole family and every time is exceptional. Fantastic service, food, and atmosphere.
This place is beautiful on the inside and just as delicious as the decor. The salmon is the best I've had in Vegas. Service is perfection, ask for Kurt! Yoda enjoyed his visit immensely.
The eggplant parm is fantastic. The service is inconsistent. The owner is always around and a great guy.

My husband and I really enjoyed our meal here. We had Kurt waiting on us and although he was very busy he never made us feel neglected. I had lobster ravioli which was very good but not on the menu. Kurt made sure I could have it though:) We had the calamari to start and the New England clam chowder soup. Both were delicious! The playlist had a lot of jazz music several songs that made us reminisce of our wedding day. Great place for a great night.

Every time my husband and I go to Las Vegas (about 4 times a year) we have at least 1 of our dinners at Mastrioni's.  My husband is especially fussy about Italian food and we both love the food here.  The service is also great.  I can hardly wait for our next visit to Las Vegas next week.  Guess where we will go to dinner?  We have even seen some local celebrities at the restaurant.

We got a bowl of tomato basil soup, salmon and veal, which were all good. Sizes run on the smaller side, similar with any upscale restaurant. Spotted probably 3 or 4 doctors with families inside. Nice atmosphere, good for having a conversation, not loud at all inside and overall a quaint space. Next time would try some of the Italian food but it was definitely a bit pricier. If you have the budget to spare, it's worth going.

Wow !!! What a hidden gem is this place. We when here with my fiancée for our one year anniversary. I didn't expect to be as good as the review said they would be. But it delivery greatness in our meal. 
I forgot to try their garlic knots, but will most definitely become a regular. Reminds me of a nice joint I used to go to in Hollywood California. Anyway. This is what I had. 
We started with shrimp scampi the shrimp was jumbo shrimp. It was hugeee ( trump voice ). Very savory. Followed by bruschetta and end with our entree she had grill salmon with spinach and I had chicken penne spinach with pink sauce which I think that's they're home made sauce. I can't wait to go again and try other appetizer and entree.

One of my new favorite places to eat. 

The service was excellent and so was the food. The restaurant itself is nice with very modern decor. I wasn't crazy thrilled about the music. It was very "elevator type". The jazzy kind that puts you right to sleep. 

Other than that, our waiter was super attentive. A bit eccentric, but was very on top of his tables. 

We had:
Caesar salad. It was good, but it was pretty overpriced for how small it was. It was the size of a small side salad for $12. 
The crab cocktail. Again, it was overpriced for how little of crab you get. It's maybe 1-2 full snow crab legs for $21. That's just silliness. 

For the entrees - oddly enough, they're decently priced. 
The Shrimp and Scallop Vodka Penne - very yummy. Would recommend on angel hair pasta. 
Sea Bass Picatta - Mother, this was good. The Seabass just melts in your mouth...better than chocolate. I love any white fish with a good citrus butter sauce. So freaking excellent. 

Overall, everything was good. We were super happy with our experience.

I've been meaning to review this restaurant for quite some time now, as it is my to go to spot here in Las Vegas for Italian. If you want simply the finest Italian food in Las Vegas this will be your spot too. The chef and staff are on point with excellent service.  I come here often and the key to finding the finest restaurants is consistency. Each and every experience has been five-star here and I would recommend this restaurant to each and every person I know... The atmosphere is quite pleasant and they also offer a lunch service.

After driving by Mastrioni's several dozen times, we decided to try it after reading the other reviews on Yelp.  We went on a Sunday night and the exterior of the restaurant is rather plain and unassuming but, once inside the place is very modern and nice.  We started with crab cakes and fried calamari.  The crab cakes were better.  The chicken piccata and the chicken marsala were excellent.  Service was very attentive and personable.  The noise level was just right, not too loud or too subdued.  Since it was our first visit we gave it four stars but we'll make this a regular neighborhood place to dine and see if the other items on the menu will bring up our score.

My husband and  I came here tonight for a late Valentine's day dinner date. Our server, Dane was very upbeat and cheerful, which was already a good sign to me. He was very helpful when we were deciding on an appetizer, but he made the creamy mozzarella cheese with heirloom tomatoes appetizer sound so enticing that we had to order it as well as our original idea, bruchetta.  
My huband got the osso bucco which he really enjoyed. I got the seafood comno with angel hair rather than the linguini that comes with it by default with white sauce. I really enjoyed my dish, but towards the end it was harder to enjoy just because I was so full, haha.
I want to come again to try out the other dishes and I am sure that everything else is just as delicious.

Solid Italian food spot in Summerlin :)

We started off with the Complimentary Bread with Olive Olive and Vinegar.  Good!

Pasta E Fagioli ($5 Cup): Cannellini Beans & Pasta. This was good overall. Heavy on the beans...it was not finished.  I would skip this personally.

Grilled Chicken Sandwich ($12): Chicken Breast, Roasted Peppers, Baby Greens & Goat Cheese. Pretty good! Good flavored chicken with lots of greens/veggies.  Fair portion size as well. 

Veal Parmagiana ($16): Baked Breaded Veal Scaloppini, Marinara & Mozzarella.  This was good, with thinly sliced veal and lots of flavor in the baked cheese.  Recommended!

Penne Marinara was my side choice with entree. The pasta was under-cooked, and the sauce was a bit on the sweet side. I'd choose the steamed veggies or sauteed spinach next time.  Skip this too.

Give em a try if you are in the area.  I wouldn't drive all the way across town for it again though.
World class Italian in a very vibe way off the strip location . About 15 min drive from strip , Wil definitely return for a superb meal . You need a car or uber worth the  trip

A nice quiet Italian  Restaurant, near Summerlin.  White tablecloths,excellent service. Great food, priced fairly  The veal dishes were excellent. the pasta along with it was fine.My friend loved the pasta with white clam sauce.  Was our first time, and it is a success.

This place is a cute hole in a wall fancy Italian place. The service was great. The food was good but kinda too pricey in my opinion. 

Seafood linguini was nice had good pasta to seafood ratio but the portion could be larger

The corn and soft shell crab chowder was very delicious not too creamy or salty. The soft chill crab had a nice crunch/bite to it.  However it was not with the price and he portion could be larger

The only thing good about the visit was the food. The service was horrible, and they made us feel as if we didn't belong in their restaurant. I would not return to this restaurant, and even though the food was good, it was overpriced  for the quality, and definitely overpriced for the lack of quality service.

Awesome food , first time there.  I didn't know what expect. I was relying on yelp review hoping that I will be embarrassed in front of the guest they came through they did a  great job. Will go back for sure .

Very good place 
Appetizers are little overpriced ( its why only 4 stars) but very good food

Great little spot up in Summerlin. It looks like just a sandwich shop from the outside but once inside it is gorgeous and they serve the best italian food in vegas. The seafood salad is the most freshest seafood I have ever had and you don't even need dressing on it. Make sure to grab one of the chicken dishes. They are extremely moist and so juicy.

A good friend had brought me here for dinner & I was superbly impressed by the dinner & service.

Nice assortment of wine & lot of choices for entree. Dessert was mediocre, but I'd definitely go back again.

I love this place. It's romantic and always so clean with great service. The food is always to die for. I recommend the shrimp scampi, ny strip steak, veal, halibut and the seafood pasta with white sauce. Best restaurant in town!!!

After hearing so many great things about this place, we finally made it for an early lunch. We were the first guests in the restaurant and the only table being serviced by our waiter. Outside of the over dressed caesar salad and the burnt garlic bread ( we did not complain), the food was very good. The calamari was hot and crispy and tender, the veal and eggplant parms did not diappoint and the grouper picatta was delicious. What spoiled the experience for us was our waiter. Even though we were his only table for most of our lunch, he seemed hell bent on ignoring us. It got even worse when he picked up another table of two. I would return for the food and hope that our poor service was a singular occurance.

This is a favorite of ours. ;) This place gives you the 'back-east" Mom and Pop feeling the minute you walk through the door.  In fact, we enjoy the food so much, that we bring our out of town visitors here to dine with us-thus avoiding the strip prices with the same- if not better quality of Italian food. For an extra special experience, sit at the bar and watch the chefs in action.  They often put on a funny, unscripted show-full animation while busting each others chops. 

You can't go wrong with the following:
*Seafood Risotto (usually on the special list) FULL of succulent seafood and rice cooked to perfection.
*Chicken Marsala- tender and flavorful
*All of their delicious salads-especially the Summerlin salad
*The veal 
*Their pasta gravy  (almost as good as mine!) 

We think  the overzealous owner and crew deserve a pat on the back for a rare find in the desert. Salute!

The food was extremely disappointing. We ordered linguini with clams and I'm pretty sure they were canned clams. The service was ok. Young, inexperienced servers with a ton of enthusiasm who didn't know the difference between black pepper and chili pepper flakes.

Chef Pete and Xilan make you feel like you just walked into your mom's kitchen.    Not an extensive wine list but an adequate one.   The specials are always fresh and diverse.  Tonight they had fresh oysters from Virginia..We were pleasantly surprised of their size and taste.   If you come to las Vegas and want a very special spot off the strip come here.  Added bonus..Come after sunset and the elevated views of the strip are unforgettable.

Delicious Italian food!  This is an excellent option if you want to dine off of the Vegas Strip; it's a bit more relaxing and low key.  We ordered a bunch of appetizers and entrees and shared family style.

My favorite dish had to be the lobster ravioli... it was smothered in a delicious white cream sauce and filled with succulent lobster chunks!

I also loved the grilled sea bass... the toasty grilled flavor was slight but what stood out the most was the tender flakiness of the fish.  Perfection.  The accompanying bed of sautéed spinach tasted wonderful with a squeeze of lemon juice.

Clam linguine was alright-- the pasta was al dente, and the sauce was quite light.  The clams were of a generous size, and it was quite convenient having the small seafood fork to remove the meat from the shell.

The crab cakes were a bit dry.  Perhaps they deep fried it for too long?  It wasn't moist.

Also loved the tomato bisque-- it was served very hot, and stayed hot for awhile!  The creaminess of the soup balanced out the acidic tomato taste.  Very good combination.  

Expect the seafood entrees to run around $30-35.  The appetizers run anywhere from $8-15.

We were here for quite awhile... and I noticed that the longer we took to eat, the slower the service got LOL.  So slow, that when we wanted to order dessert, it took FOREVER for them to come back, until we finally just said we'll have to pass on dessert.  We had a show in downtown LV to catch!

Just had to post a review. Yes, as my wife says, I guess I am, and I hate this discription, a food snob. But no worries, on food, service and atmosphere, this is a real 5 star place. On our regular server, Kurt, he does an great job, has a good sense of humor and works to make sure you enjoy the visit.

When it comes to food, my husband is the ultimate snob. (There is no excuse to be a snob doesn't matter how well the person can cook!) Anyways, this is a classy yet low profile Italian joint that actually pleases him every single time. The vibe is always pleasant in here. My personal favorite is the Veal Marsala, and calamari is consistently yummy. You can never go wrong with the Osso Bucco! It is the tastiest and you don't have to wait for a couple of hours like you are making it at home. It also doesn't hurt the joint is literally 0.2 miles away from my house.
Haven't been in for awhile but delicious pasta dishes, chicken Francese and deserts. Nice atmosphere. Great for dates and celebrations!

We have been going to Mastronis for the last  25 plus years, of course at different locations. Pete, who is the owner, is a great chef and has trained his staff well. The food is consistently good. Everything from shrimp cocktail to all the fresh seafood and his pasta dishes are excellent! The veal
Marsala and chicken piccata are great. For desert try the fresh cream puffs, to die for!!

My first time here saw the reviews and thought I would try as it's right around the corner from my house. The service is 5 star so the rating is for the food I thought I would try the old standard spaghetti and meatballs  the portion is huge with 2 softball size meatballs I was impressed with the plate of food set before me. Then I tasted it the sauce was nice and fresh but horribly sour being italian I know sour sauce. Then I cut into the meatball I saw no sign of onion or garlic or anything but meat it tasted like a round plain burger. Needless to say I was so let down. With a good italian name like that I was so underwealmed. This place could be the best italian restaurant in town but the chef needs to go back to basics a little sugar in the sauce and some sautéed garlic onion basil salt and pepper in the meatball you would have 5 star food to match your 5 star service. I will try them again but will probably get a steak until the red sauce improves

Greg, his parents and I all had another awesome meal at Mastrioni's!  I had Chicken Francese, Jerry had Veal Piccata and Greg and Dale both had the Shrimp and Scallop Vodka.  Everything was wonderful, and our server, Kurt, was the best!  Can't wait to go back!

I have been meaning to leave this review for a few days now and am just not finding time for it so unfortunately our server's name has slipped my mind. However, he (I believe his name may have been Austin but he had tattoos and was new) did a fantastic job! We were surprised to hear he is fairly new due to his menu knowledge and the food recommendations he provided. Hubby and I ordered a bottle of wine, he did chicken piccata that he raves about and I ordered the lobster ravioli. Everything was fantastic. The ambience was exactly what we look for in a date night and at no point during our coffee or dessert (cream puffs are amazing!) did we feel rushed at all. Bravo to the training team, the chefs and management. We will be back!

The food was so amazing. Service was the best I've had in a very long time. Or   name was Kurt. He was friendly funny. Very informative on the specials. Oh and what was on the menu. I would recommend this restaurant. To anyone I know. Definitely going to go back here.

Also, their dishes need updating! The food was served on what was clearly a very old white plate with hundreds of scratches and marks everywhere. Kind of throws you off eating a meal and at the same time thinking of all the other people eating off that same plate!

Impressions. "I'm gonna make him an offer he won't refuse." 
Ok, joking aside, I truly believe first impressions are important but don't tell the whole story.  This is one of those times. So here we go.  

Walking up to this small strip mall storefront, I was wondering what I was getting myself into but my daughter insisted we eat close to Golden Spoon Yogurt so we could get a good desert.  So in we go.  The dark room reminded me of the Godfather so I started to get the Italian feel. "Cenare"

Being from back east, the first lesson I learned about Italian Restaurants is you can tell a good restaurant by the bread they serve you.  I will admit the west coast doesn't always follow that rule, maybe because few restaurants have the old brick ovens but I was disappointed in the bread served. You could get better bread at Vons. 

My next impression, was the menu.  Everything looked good and the standard Italian fare (veal parmagiani, Pastas, etc) was broadened by seafood dishes.  The prices were much higher than I would expect from a strip mall store much to my disappointment.  (see below for part of the reason why).

 I was here with my daughter and she ordered the Kids portion of the Penne Marinara.  I opted for spaghetti and meatballs as I didn't want to break the wallet and was craving comfort foods.  The specials sounded great (Lobster Ravioli and Seafood Risotto) but I went with the standard. After all, if an Italian place can't do Spaghetti and Meatballs right, well the rest of the dishes might as well be frozen dinners. 

The penne was good, The kids sauce not too spicy but, and here is the pricing issue, the kids portion was enough for an adult.  The adult portion was huge.  The meatballs themselves looked like the Bull won. (Old off color joke, you can send me a private message if you don't get it.) Lets just say they were huge.  They were surprisingly light and flavorful if on the spicy side.  When I make meatballs or eat at some other restaurants, the meatballs are often too dense. These were perfect.  The Spaghetti on the other hand tasted a little overcooked and the sauce, although flavored with spiciness, lacked the garlic I hoped for and was a bit watery.  I usually finish my food but I was able to bring home one of the two meatballs and half the spaghetti and my daughter brought home more than 1/2 her meal.

The service here made this place stand out.  Our waiter was polite, informative about the specials, and attentive.  My drink never sat for more than a minute without him offering to refill the Coke or my daughter's lemonade. In fact, the busboy and another waiter also took time to make sure I was fine on the drinks.  I drink fast so that was a plus.  They brought us butter for the bread on request (otherwise you just get olive oil and balsamic). They also told us about deserts without trying to push them on us.

Overall, except for the price and the dichotomy between spicy and watery sauce, I ended up impressed.  If I could change one thing, I would make the portions 1/2 the size and cut the price by $5.00 but hey, they must do ok to maintain those prices in such a low traffic area.

Buon Appetito

A Vegas institution.  A must go in Summerlin.
The diver scallops were to die for.  The only reason for not giving 5 stars was service was a bit slow and inattentive.  One of the best veal dishes I have ever had

Just a fantastic evening.Kurt was amazing very knowledgeable about the food and a great personality the food was spectacular. My wife an I both left saying it was one of the best meals we have had congrats to the whole staff Merry Christmas.

One of my families favorites we met last night for dinner. I would recommended making a reservation for the weekends. 

Manhattan straight up was great. I ordered the Shrimp and Linguini combo by far my favorite. Featuring shrimp, scallops, clams, mussels and calamari in a red or white sauce over linguini. Make sure to get red and highly recommend the hottest they can make it. Its not overly spicy and it does not cancel out the flavors. 

Also make sure to get an order of their cream puffs they are amazing. Great menu, atmosphere, and service. Highly recommend it!

Very good!!! Delicious!!! Amazing service!!
The alferdo  pasta wow!!
And a pretty place;)

We have been wanting to stop in and try the food for a long time.. finally made the reservation.

The food and the service did not disappoint.. amazing is an understatement.

We will definitely be back many times.

I've eaten at Pete's restaurant more than 40 times and I'm finally writing him a well deserved review.  

The seafood is amazing and everything is priced perfectly.  Everyone who works here is extremely friendly and welcoming.  

My wife and I are looking forward to our next trip to Vegas so we can dine here several more times.

I'm not sure if I'm lucky or if it's super dangerous, but Mastrioni's is a few blocks from our new house and after seeing it on Yelp we've been anxious to try it out. Decided to go on a whim for my Mother's birthday after she asked for "hole in the wall" Italian. Well, there's nothing "hole in the wall" about Mastrioni's... it's a classy little joint in a non-descript strip mall on Hualapai. We have a two year old, which is the main reason we haven't been here sooner since it's not really a "kid-friendly" spot,  but I figured a Wednesday night would probably be slow and safe. Not so much. By 7 o'clock this place was jam packed! Thankfully, the little criminal behaved wonderfully and we got to enjoy one of the better Italian dinners we've had in a long time. We had calamari and crab cakes for appetizers, calamari was good but the crab cakes were excellent. Mom had the bone in rib-eye, hubs had the seafood linguine and I had linguine and clams. This is your tried and true Italian, better than probably any other I've had in Vegas and would rival any of my favorite spots in California. I'd say it's more like $$$, but they are very generous with the portions/seafood. Dessert was excellent as well and service was on point. We will definitely be back and will probably become our new date night spot.
We eat here multiple times a week.....food is amazing.  We live chef Shawn and his staff. Wonderful atmosphere - saw Santana the other day.
Always excellent Italian food.   Knowledgeable servers.  I always get the shrimp parmigiana.  Great place to bring your out of towners if you want to impress!
A good go-to restaurant. It is definitely on my list of favorites.

Meh, not 5-star dining. It's Italian food with a touch of fancy. Nothing on the menu seems to vary off the Italian traditionals. It would have been nice to see a touch of innovation and use of more varied ingredients. 

The service was subpar. Our server was what my wife called "abrupt". He seemed to come and go very rapidly without actually seeming to care about our dining experience. I got a beer and the chilled glass that came with it smelled (and made my beer taste) like bleach, so I requested a new one. The server poured a little bit in then basically slammed them on the table as he was already mid-stride to do something else. The second glass was similar so I drank out of the bottle after the initial bleachy-tasting pour was consumed. The waiter saw me sniffing at my glass again and just came by and collected the glass and took it away - not even asking if I had a repeat experience (which I did). 

The wife got the Seabass PIcatta...it was an okay size piece and it was cooked well. The picatta sauce (lemon and capers) was entirely too lemony. Would not recommend the picatta.I wouldn't call it a $36 dollar dish either. 

I heard Osso Bucco was one of the specials and I can never turn that down. It came out looking great atop fettuccini with a good sauce. The Osso Bucco itself was good but could have used a little more braising to make it more tender as the meat was a little firm. Overall it was below average comparatively. I was a bit surprised when I got the bill and it was $42.

We have been here multiple times and always have a great experience! Last 2 times my husband and I have been here, Kurt has been our waiter and has recommended all amazing things. We will continue to come here!

Love this place!! Came for first time recently to celebrate my mothers birthday and experience was excellent.  The food was excellent staff is realy nice and attentive couldn't have asked for more.  This is home made  Italian food here you won't be disappointed. Will definitely be back soon..

I don't tend to go out and order pasta much, since I prefer to make it at home. Call me narcissistic, but my carbonara is legit. It had been over a couple years since I had ordered pasta, and on this particular day, I was really craving fetucinne alfredo. 

The pasta was underwhelming for me. It lacked flavor, so I had to season it myself. And I guess it is super simple. For the price, I wasn't too stoked. 

I think the salad I had was quite good...loved the dressing. 
I'm not sure I'd be back here though.

Not my family's kind of restaurant. We look for good food, good portions, good price. Mastrioni's is okay food wise, but the other two points are lacking. 

Service itself was fast and efficient. Almost to the point we felt rushed because they are busy and we aren't ordering a 3+ course meal. They did a great job getting us bread and water refills. 

It is nice enough to do for a special dinner date night where money is no object but if it comes down to tasty expensive food to splurge on, I would go back to Lotus of Siam.

The food is awesome. I've been driving by this place for years and wished I had stopped by sooner. Kurt was great, very personable, and suggested some really good dishes. The service was excellent,I'll definitely be coming here more often.

Everything was done with precision and flavor.   Sit at the open kitchen and watch the team work.    The little details make it outstanding.   Sliced roasted garlic, perfectly cooked scallops , oysters that are not just fresh but meaty!    Calamari fried with the ideal crunch .    Defiantly a must when visiting Vegas.

The food was incredible the service was fantastic. We celebrated a birthday there and it was a party of 10 and every dish that was ordered was top of the line for some of the best Italian food in that part of Las Vegas. The the owner Pete is the man!
Oh the pasta here is definitely one of the bests in town by far! Great portions their huge! Very friendly staff and service was wonderful. Couldn't ask for more!

This is around the corner from my postal address (so I collect my post there a lot) and en-route to my attorney. I stopped in with my kids-it looks very unassuming so I figured my toddler could eat something and my infant wouldn't be disturbing a "high class" restaurant. Well luckily she didn't!!! It is pretty classy, excellent wait staff, top notch really, amazing menu and food good enough that I broke my diet for the veal!!! Highly recommend.
First time eating here. Ordered carry out. The baked ziti was very good. Definitely going back to explore the menu. :))

Seafood is the name of the game here at Mastrioni's. We dined here for lunch during a work lunch and I made reservations ahead of time. We arrived early and there was no wait but the restaurant filled up quickly. 

Despite arriving before the crowd we were a little disappointed to get very little attention there at first. Drinks, menus and bread were slow to come.  Once we got the attention of our waiter it was still slow to get appetizers and entrees ordered but we were happy to indulge in bread as we waited.

Our entire table ordered fish dishes. I went with the halibut piccata and we shared the bruschetta as an appetizer. The bruschetta had a huge amount of tomato. It was delicious. The fish was well prepared. I enjoyed everything about my meal. 

The service was lackluster but I am still excited to come back and try them again.
My mom and I went there the other day..I had shrimp scampi and it was delicious..my mother had halibut picatta and she said it was fantastic..service was perfect..finally a good meal
